revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-11 15:21:43.000000000', 'message': 'Metadata-API fails to retrieve avz for instances created before Pike

In Pike we started setting instance.avz during schedule time by calculating
the avz of the host into which the instance was shceduled into. After this
change was introduced, the metadata request for the avz on the instance
started using instance.get(availability_zone) instead of doing the upcall.
However this would return None for instances older than Pike whose avz was not
mentioned during boot time as it would be set to CONF.default_scheduling_zone
whose default value is None.

This patch adds an online_migration tool to populate missing instance.avz values.

Change-Id: I2a1d81bfeb1ea006c16d8f403e045e9acedcbe57
Closes-Bug: #1768876

commit_message:
Metadata-API fails to retrieve avz for instances created before Pike

In Pike (through change: I8d426f2635232ffc4b510548a905794ca88d7f99)
we started setting instance.avilability_zone during schedule time by
calculating the avz of the host into which the instance was scheduled
into. After this change was introduced, the metadata request for the avz
on the instance (through change: I73c3b10e52ab4cfda9dacc0c0ba92d1fcb60bcc9)
started using instance.get(availability_zone) instead of doing the upcall.
However this would return None for instances older than Pike whose
availability_zone was not mentioned during boot time as it would be set to
CONF.default_schedule_zone whose default value is None.

This patch adds an online_migration tool to populate missing
instance.availability_zone values.

Change-Id: I2a1d81bfeb1ea006c16d8f403e045e9acedcbe57
Closes-Bug: #1768876

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-30 17:38:02.000000000', 'message': 'Set server_id when using binlogs

Percona-cluster was failing to start when enable-binlogs was set to
True due to missing server_id in the configuration.

Set the server_id to a unique, non-zero, positive number from 1 to
2**32 - 1.

Closes-Bug: #1772947
Change-Id: Id7da6dd8f27e364e0d5244e4ec33ae4645e4ef96
'}]
commit_message:
Set server_id when using binlogs

Percona-cluster was failing to start when enable-binlogs was set to
True due to missing server_id in the configuration.

Set the server_id to a unique, non-zero, positive number from 1 to
2**32 - 1.

Closes-Bug: #1772947
Change-Id: Id7da6dd8f27e364e0d5244e4ec33ae4645e4ef96

[{'created': '2018-05-29 12:09:25.000000000', 'message': 'Missing request parameters in update quotas

"backup_gigabytes" and "per_volume_gigabytes" parameters
are supported in api v2, they aren't mentioned in api v2
document[1]. On the other hand both of them are mentioned
in api v3 document[2].

[1] https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/block-storage/
    v2/index.html#update-quotas
[2] https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/block-storage/
    v3/index.html?highlight=backup_gigabytes#update-quotas
    -for-a-project

Change-Id: I135efd5c2b4735f5821922643926390976453bf5
Closes-bug: #1727631
'}]
commit_message:
Missing request parameters in update quotas

"backup_gigabytes" and "per_volume_gigabytes" parameters
are supported in api v2, they aren't mentioned in api v2
document[1]. On the other hand both of them are mentioned
in api v3 document[2].

[1] https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/block-storage/
    v2/index.html#update-quotas
[2] https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/block-storage/
    v3/index.html?highlight=backup_gigabytes#update-quotas
    -for-a-project

Change-Id: I135efd5c2b4735f5821922643926390976453bf5
Closes-bug: #1727631

commit_message:
Listen to all interfaces by default

Rather than listening to localhost only, listen to all interfaces by
default.

Change-Id: Ifb870fdadfc55ab4b06fa891a92f82ab2c51bcf2

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-21 16:04:05.000000000', 'message': 'Fix MariaDB bootstrap error

grep returns exitcode 1 when no match is found.
Since `set -o errexit` is done in base/start.sh, we need to use `|| true`.
Also, the CLUSTER_READY var was not being updated inside the loop.

Change-Id: I909cf181c677f61fd76a7128027f89afa5eeac7b
Closes-Bug: 1772442
'}, {'created': '2018-05-21 16:52:14.000000000', 'message': 'Fix MariaDB bootstrap error

Change-Id: I909cf181c677f61fd76a7128027f89afa5eeac7b

(cherry picked from commit 6f1a7ceb7c6d1e612e23667d78eb059a2e4c5164)

commit_message:
Fix MariaDB bootstrap error

grep returns exitcode 1 when no match is found.
Since `set -o errexit` is done in base/start.sh, we need to get rid of grep.

Change-Id: I909cf181c677f61fd76a7128027f89afa5eeac7b
Closes-Bug: 1772442
(cherry picked from commit 6f1a7ceb7c6d1e612e23667d78eb059a2e4c5164)

commit_message:
Don't install cmd2>=0.9

Version 0.9.0 of cmd2 requires Python 3.4+, so we cap the cmd2 version
at 0.8.6.

Depends-On: I568e649ec5fdd0bf875d7ac3ff630e9b6bae6426
Change-Id: Ib83cd47e17b3800a67aa16b3957563b0a401b841

commit_message:
Replace deprecated library function os.popen() with subprocess

os.popen() is deprecated since version 2.6. Resolved with use of
subprocess module.

commit_message:
Fix pip package version

The python "cmd2" package installs version 0.9+ on Python 2.7,
which only support Python 3.4+. This causes a dependency error in
the gate due to issue outlined in [0].  We will pre-install a
capped version of "cmd2" that would work with Python 2.7.

[0] https://github.com/python-cmd2/cmd2/issues/421

Depends-On: I34cbde65b74efc2805bd7785f84878783d2badbf

Change-Id: I35c5b1cf2253bd3ab953745a795be8ac42668053
Signed-off-by: Tin Lam <tin@irrational.io>

commit_message:
Follow-up -- replace 'auditor' role with 'reader'

Follow-up patch after Vancouver summit. After discussion the term
'reader' was determined to be more appropriate than 'auditor' as
a default name for roles.

Change-Id: Ia99807952d4f1025a69e9c94edf1ea949afb7d09

commit_message:
Remove deprecated rabbit params

Remove the deprecated rabbit params which has been deprecated for
two years. The default_transport_url has been present for a while
now and should be used.

Change-Id: I0e220dddaac2cf35b84ba1d3cfcc0fe587acbbaa

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-21 12:22:45.000000000', 'message': "Handle port's 'port_security_enabled' flag when adding ACLs

When a port's security groups are cleared and 'port_security_enabled'
flag is True, it is expected that all the traffic to/from the port is dropped.
But this is not the case. So this patch fixes this issue. 'port_security_enabled'
flag is checked before adding the port's ACLs.

So the new (and correct) behaviour with this patch is
 - No security groups and port security enabled -> Drop all the traffic
 - No security groups and port security disabled -> Allow all the traffic

Change-Id: I5265da4c21e58672db9858555625c8e2c5350316
Closes-bug: #1770723
(cherry picked from commit d97a670257fb67917e2b5da4c944b9e29a5d7855)
"}]
commit_message:
Handle port's 'port_security_enabled' flag when adding ACLs

When a port's security groups are cleared and 'port_security_enabled'
flag is True, it is expected that all the traffic to/from the port is dropped.
But this is not the case. So this patch fixes this issue. 'port_security_enabled'
flag is checked before adding the port's ACLs.

So the new (and correct) behaviour with this patch is
 - No security groups and port security enabled -> Drop all the traffic
 - No security groups and port security disabled -> Allow all the traffic

Change-Id: I5265da4c21e58672db9858555625c8e2c5350316
Closes-bug: #1770723
(cherry picked from commit d97a670257fb67917e2b5da4c944b9e29a5d7855)

commit_message:
ScaleIO: Rebranding of product to VxFlex OS

The Dell EMC ScaleIO product is being renamed to
Dell EMC VxFlex OS. Update the documentation to reflect
the new product name.

Change-Id: Ib52e4820c80db8b2a74bd91dce473182508c7fba

commit_message:
Adds constraints to all pip installs

Recently we ran into trouble with the cmd2 extension's
latest version being python3 only. This exposed the need
to constrain all pip installs (as it should have been)

Change-Id: I8f27bddd45905c14bec486c515b5b190c66eaf20

commit_message:
overcloud plan deployment status

Add a new command to tripleoclient:
openstack overcloud plan deployment status

The command shows the top level deployment status based on a plan name
and makes use of the
tripleo.plan_management.v1.get_plan_deployment_status workflow.

Change-Id: I600fe9b83b69aee64d8ca44e405d0c5e7a20a273
Depends-On: Ia8e3ecadfb97c0827c396cd418c32d3daa2e299b

commit_message:
Add workflow for plan deployment status

Add a new workflow used for checking the plan deployment status. With
the move to config-download, the Heat API is no longer the source of
truth for deployment status.

This patch makes use of the top level deployment_status added in
Ib854689a3e606f18db7354427918fa8043ac28e0 to expose the deployment
status via a workflow.

Implements: blueprint config-download-default

Change-Id: Ia8e3ecadfb97c0827c396cd418c32d3daa2e299b

import method is 'glance-direct', it would require a shared
consistent staging location on the controller nodes otherwise it
might happen that the image is uploaded to one node and triggering

commit_message:
Add support of shared staging location for glance-direct

In the case of an HA setup (ie with 3 controller nodes) if image
import method is 'glance-direct', it would require a shared
consistent staging location on the controller nodes otherwise it
might happen that the image is uploaded to one node and triggering
the import is executed on a different node - where the image does not
exist.

Hence when import method 'glance-direct' is needed, operators need to
enable it explicitly with enabling NFS across the controller nodes
to share the staging.

Change-Id: I9a5bff5e5d0c3e109b73d691cc9088904a0401ac
Closes-Bug: #1765439
(cherry picked from commit a089310bf3269339ddec36e8ba021b67a18abfd0)
Conflicts:
        puppet/services/glance-api.yaml

commit_message:
container-updater: log LockTimeout exceptions at INFO, not ERROR

Lock timeouts happen, especially on very busy containers. It's not
worth a stack trace, and it's not an error. Now we still log the
lock timeout, but at INFO level and without a stack trace.

Change-Id: Ia202c876fb726f9ae6040d875a83105dd975539b

commit_message:
Fix pip package version

The python "cmd2" package installs version 0.9+ on Python 2.7, which only
support Python 3.4+. This causes a dependency error in the gate due to
issue outlined in [0].  We will pre-install a capped version of "cmd2"
that would work with Python 2.7.

This patch set also temporarily make the keystone webhook non-voting as
this bug is causing a circular dependencies with patch [1]. Once this is
fixed, a new patch will be submitted to make this voting again.

[0] https://github.com/python-cmd2/cmd2/issues/421
[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/571093/

Change-Id: I34cbde65b74efc2805bd7785f84878783d2badbf

The spec look good to me, If you have a chance re-spin please consider my comments.'}, {'account_id': 15905, 'date': '2018-04-23 06:56:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 13702, 'date': '2018-04-24 08:21:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12: Code-Review+2

Thanks for updating!  LGTM'}, {'account_id': 13995, 'date': '2018-04-24 14:13:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 6995, 'date': '2018-04-26 13:54:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12: Code-Review+2

Thanks Hoang, Cuong. Looks good to me and it is largely a re-implementation of the work done for SG. Also we will stage it so that L3 will be implemented first and then L2.'}, {'account_id': 10850, 'date': '2018-04-26 16:11:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12: Code-Review+1

(3 comments)

some moments - if we want to respin the spec'}, {'account_id': 24441, 'date': '2018-04-27 08:31:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:

Hi German,

IIRC in original patch of sec group logging, we already had a long discussion with other reviewers about your concerns. I think your concerns are reasonable, if you want we can investigate it more. But as you can see, this spec looks good enough to be merged now and we can dig into these issues after the merge. Would you agree?'}, {'account_id': 10850, 'date': '2018-04-27 14:12:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 12: Code-Review+2

Yes, that shouldn't hold up merging."}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-05-01 23:03:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:

(4 comments)

one question inline.'}, {'account_id': 15471, 'date': '2018-05-03 02:48:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 15471, 'date': '2018-05-03 03:33:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:

(6 comments)'}, {'account_id': 15905, 'date': '2018-05-04 02:52:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 13.'}, {'account_id': 13995, 'date': '2018-05-08 14:18:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13: Code-Review+1

This looks good to me, I think this is a solid enough basis to implement upon.'}, {'account_id': 13702, 'date': '2018-05-11 08:17:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 13: Code-Review+2

Thanks for updating, Hoang.  Waiting for driver's core :)"}, {'account_id': 6995, 'date': '2018-05-11 14:26:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13: Code-Review+2

Thanks for addressing the last set of comments.'}, {'account_id': 10850, 'date': '2018-05-11 14:40:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13: Code-Review+2

I am still a bit wary that we expose ourselves to GDPR and the original spec probably punts the whole issue to Monasca. That said, most people will have to either switch off logging in production or have Monasca handle the regulatory burden. Personally, I would like to see us having some compliant mode where we anonymize data right at the log driver but this is out of scope for this.

@mlavalle we probably need to improve the spec template and have a GDPR/Compliance section to address those concerns early.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-05-18 12:58:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13:

(1 comment)

Let me ask one more question.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-05-18 13:03:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 13: Code-Review-1

L2 and L3 logging drivers will handle different technologies (ovs-fw and iptables), so I don't think it is a good idea to both L2 and L3 logging agent extension consume a single driver which cover L2 and L3 firewall implementation.

(If L2 and L3 firewall implementations are both iptables, there might be a room that L2/L3 logging agent extension load a single logging driver for iptables, but I don't think this is the case discussed in this spec.)"}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-05-18 13:03:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13:

This spec is near to merge, and the impact of my question would be small, so let me keep my -1.'}, {'account_id': 15471, 'date': '2018-05-24 17:52:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 15905, 'date': '2018-05-28 08:25:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 14.'}, {'account_id': 15905, 'date': '2018-05-28 08:26:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 14:

Thank you for your kind review and attention.

@amotoki: I've updated the point."}, {'account_id': 13702, 'date': '2018-05-29 04:23:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 14: Code-Review+2

Thanks Hoang for updating.  I agree with this change.  It's reasonable.  Waiting for Akihiro and other driver's core :)"}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-05-29 13:35:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 14: Code-Review+2

Thanks for your patience. Looks good now.'}, {'account_id': 13995, 'date': '2018-05-29 13:43:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 14: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 6995, 'date': '2018-05-29 14:14:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 14: Code-Review+2

Thanks for the update Cao - it is more clear now reg L2 and L3.'}, {'account_id': 15471, 'date': '2018-05-30 00:56:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 14: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 4694, 'date': '2018-05-30 17:33:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 14: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

I think we have enough +2s. Let's merge it"}]

commit_message:
Fix py27 job in specs repo

In py27 job index.rst file was checked as any other file if it
contains required headers and sections.
But index.rst file has different format so this file should be
skipped in this test.

After that there was also issue with unexpected "Footnotes"
section in neutron-inter.rst specs so this was also fixed.

Change-Id: If2baf887c49025a5481e97b2fb3500736b8668b6

subject: Add ansible functional tests
messages:
[{'account_id': 2, 'date': '2018-05-27 13:43:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2018-05-27 13:55:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2018-05-27 13:59:05.000000000', 'content': 'Topic set to ansible-openstacksdk'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2018-05-27 15:24:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 27900, 'date': '2018-05-28 10:25:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

I think unless we have ansible 2.6 released we need -d options to run-ansible-tests to fetch devel (instead of pip).'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2018-05-29 13:27:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2018-05-29 13:31:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Thank you! I was going a bit crazy trying to figure out why the git version wasn't getting used."}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2018-05-29 15:58:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2018-05-29 16:13:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 27900, 'date': '2018-05-30 07:56:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+1

I guess this way it might create confusion, why it does not work locally and works in zuul. Locally you would need to invoke `tox -eansible -- **-d** -c my_cloud auth`. On the other hand it is more an transition issue unless ansible-2.6 appear in pip.'}, {'account_id': 27900, 'date': '2018-05-30 08:23:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

do you really want to leave it non-voting?'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2018-05-30 14:34:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

Yes to non-voting, although I expect us to pay attention to failures. The main reason is that it's not voting on the ansible side, so changes to ansible can break us.

As for the other - yes, I agree it's mostly a transition issue. However,  the other concern you bring up is very valid and is one that  we need a better solution for across the board in OpenStack."}, {'account_id': 3099, 'date': '2018-05-30 15:40:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2018-05-30 15:47:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Add ansible functional tests

ansible now directly depends on and uses openstacksdk rather than shade.
Make sure we don't land patches that break ansible.

Remove the installation of ansible from run-ansible-tests as it's
specified in the tox.ini file already, and we'll get it installed via
tox-siblings in the gate.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/570956
Change-Id: I35103b8c75100725caf7a8fd264b81d402bf1973

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-16 19:30:17.000000000', 'message': 'Include a rationale for tracking base services

It was pointed out in #openstack-tc[*] that we may be making some
assumptions about the reasons for base services without having fully
expressed them in any durable form. As an example, when we added a
distributed lock manager to this list the driving reason was that
several services had already implemented their own (some completely
independently, some by copying from other services and then perhaps
making modifications). There are times when we solve this problem by
adding new shared libraries, hence the remit of Oslo, but some
solutions need full-blown services in their own right which may or
may not be developed within the OpenStack community.

We also realize that deployments may be hesitant to turn on useful
features by default because they rely on yet another service, and
this hampers adoption of something which if ubiquitous would perhaps
snowball into the addition of similar useful default capabilities
in OpenStack deployments.

Change-Id: Ie85658e95dad210ea8ef838eb2fb5a571ed02cab

Change-Id: Ie85658e95dad210ea8ef838eb2fb5a571ed02cab

commit_message:
Include a rationale for tracking base services

It was pointed out in #openstack-tc[*] that we may be making some
assumptions about the reasons for base services without having fully
expressed them in any durable form. As an example, when we added a
distributed lock manager to this list the driving reason was that
several services had already implemented their own (some completely
independently, some by copying from other services and then perhaps
making modifications). There are times when we solve this problem by
adding new shared libraries, hence the remit of Oslo, but some
solutions need full-blown services in their own right which may or
may not be developed within the OpenStack community.

We also realize that deployments may be hesitant to turn on useful
features by default because they rely on yet another service, and
this hampers adoption of something which if ubiquitous would perhaps
snowball into the addition of similar useful default capabilities
in OpenStack deployments.

[*] http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-tc/%23openstack-tc.2018-05-16.log.html#t2018-05-16T17:55:51

Change-Id: Ie85658e95dad210ea8ef838eb2fb5a571ed02cab

commit_message:
Add constraints to stable/ocata

cmd2 has dropped py2 support but the upper-constraints.txt will prevent
the inclusion of the new version. We should use the stable constraints
for testing.

Change-Id: I1a5c31bb98a6d8af18c291cf7e8579745389267b
Related-Bug: #1773936

commit_message:
Note that the old incubation/graduation process is obsolete

The link to the page containing the historical incubation/graduation
requirements is labelled "Requirements for previously-used
incubation/integration process", but the document itself contained no
indication that the content was obsolete.

This role provides a general mechanism to modify existing container
images before or during a TripleO deployment. The main target use
cases are:
- during CI to refresh image packages to test changes
- developer workflows to include code being developed
- third party plugin inclusion to existing images

Change-Id: I13c24af42b765b3dd91abe470d7e23a34540b340
Depends-On: I01dfa1f939181f63e82f8001008c5c9fb89ab866
'}]
commit_message:
Import ansible-role-tripleo-modify-image

This role provides a general mechanism to modify existing container
images before or during a TripleO deployment. The main target use
cases are:
- during CI to refresh image packages to test changes
- developer workflows to include code being developed
- third party plugin inclusion to existing images

Change-Id: I13c24af42b765b3dd91abe470d7e23a34540b340
Depends-On: I01dfa1f939181f63e82f8001008c5c9fb89ab866

commit_message:

test clean up in MiscPolicyActionsNetworkRbacTest test
class to avoid errors like [0], caused by data races
on server/network clean up.

subject: Fix Random String test
messages:
[{'account_id': 12404, 'date': '2018-05-17 17:23:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 12404, 'date': '2018-05-17 17:24:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

some error log for reference: http://logs.openstack.org/94/558394/7/check/openstack-tox-py35/a0b415b/job-output.txt.gz#_2018-05-17_16_21_24_620965'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-05-17 17:49:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Testing a stochastic process is hard. There will inevitably remain some possibility of failure even when everything is working correctly. I tried to tune it so the failure rate would be <<1/1000. If we're seeing consistent failures (this is the first I've heard of) then we probably need to increase the number of trials for the failing test to reduce the variance. Increasing tolerance across the board is probably not what we want.

Specifically, allowing a mean of zero for test_class_uniformity (as this change does) would eliminate an important safety check."}, {'account_id': 12404, 'date': '2018-05-21 10:43:04.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

not like it's gonna to happen any time, so fine with keep it as it was"}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-05-30 16:29:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I saw it again (with an even higher mean that this patch wouldn't have passed either) so I redid the calculations and adjusted the limit for just the failing test: Ifc8badbdfef423a58f6378a28ddc5c5b90853c56"}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-17 17:23:32.000000000', 'message': 'Fix Random String test

The char length range of random string includes all size in
allowed_variance. So equal should be consider correct in test.

Change-Id: Ie90d46ff87cd91e18280e549e797881f41f574fd
'}]
commit_message:
Fix Random String test

The char length range of random string includes all size in
allowed_variance. So equal should be consider correct in test.

Change-Id: Ie90d46ff87cd91e18280e549e797881f41f574fd

commit_message:
add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Change-Id: I67c51b5241f25b3f01c212f5245a3a248eaaf8b8
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
use get reader/writer session from neutron-lib

The get_reader_session and get_writer_session functions are available
in neutron-lib. This patch consumes them by removing the functions
from neutron and using lib's instead in prep for
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/570603

It also bumps neutron-lib requirements to 1.14.0

Change-Id: I0326e1444049370f6cb611e853041be89cdfc606

commit_message:

commit_message:
Avoid tox-install.sh

Instead of using tox-install.sh, we can install horizon now directly
from pypi - or use the current branch in CI system using tox-siblings.

Create doc/requriements.txt for doc requirements as well.

Update tox.ini for this change and add horizon to requirements
file.

Change-Id: I35fb782b7bad4c046930926c43b0f7b3c1bb07b7

messages: [{'account_id': 2799, 'date': '2018-05-29 09:59:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-05-29 12:41:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:\n\nrecheck'}, {'account_id': 23163, 'date': '2018-05-30 10:05:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-05-30 15:12:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-29 09:59:10.000000000', 'message': 'Ensure container configuration is sorted

We convert the container networks from a dict to a list in order to
allow us to enumerate the networks and assign an ID which is required
for lxc > 3.

Since dicts are unsorted we should ensure that we sort the converted
list so that unnecessary container restarts are not initiated on
subsequent runs, where the id for the network could change due to the
initial dict being unsorted.

Change-Id: I6f86b32e05adb2e0e4e214d2eb4aa67cbc283be1
'}]
commit_message:
Ensure container configuration is sorted

We convert the container networks from a dict to a list in order to
allow us to enumerate the networks and assign an ID which is required
for lxc > 3.

Since dicts are unsorted we should ensure that we sort the converted
list so that unnecessary container restarts are not initiated on
subsequent runs, where the id for the network could change due to the
initial dict being unsorted.

Change-Id: I6f86b32e05adb2e0e4e214d2eb4aa67cbc283be1

commit_message:
Create symlinks for failed builds logs

This allows to know which image failed to build without having to parse
the huge job-output.txt file.

This commit creates a convenient 000_FAILED_image_name.log symlink to
the relevant log files when kolla is configured to output to a log
directory. This creates symlinks only for the parent image with error,
i.e. it skips images that failed to build because of parent error.

Change-Id: I05954e2335dc3fac469276809c91f9c87e3ecab2

commit_message:
Put upper limit on cmd2 in kolla-toolbox

This fixes an issue with cmd2 >= 0.9.0 requiring python3.

Conflicts:
	docker/kolla-toolbox/Dockerfile.j2

(cherry picked from commit a126aca2982b9b0078fb10f0765855fd7b81a888)

commit_message:
Update to newer keystoneauth for test mocks

With the newer version of keystoneauth in upper-constraints, we can
remove the old versions of the unittest mocks as well as the base class
helper method.

Bump the lower bounds for keystoneauth so that the unittests always
work.

Change-Id: Icf2f48431a3b74b9575d3e63477d0e3ec4f18ec8
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/569447

commit_message:
doc: Start using openstackdoctheme's extlink extension

This ensures we have version-specific references to other projects [1].
Note that this doesn't mean the URLs are actually valid - we need to do
more work (linkcheck?) here, but it's an improvement nonetheless.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/openstackdocstheme/latest/#external-link-helper

Change-Id: Ifb99e727110c4904a85bc4a13366c2cae300b8df

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 7, 'name': 'Jay Pipes', 'email': 'jaypipes@gmail.com', 'username': 'jaypipes'}, {'_account_id': 4393, 'name': 'Dan Smith', 'email': 'dms@danplanet.com', 'username': 'danms'}, {'_account_id': 4690, 'name': 'melanie witt', 'display_name': 'melwitt', 'email': 'melwittt@gmail.com', 'username': 'melwitt'}, {'_account_id': 6062, 'name': 'jichenjc', 'email': 'jichenjc@cn.ibm.com', 'username': 'jichenjc'}, {'_account_id': 6873, 'name': 'Matt Riedemann', 'email': 'mriedem.os@gmail.com', 'username': 'mriedem'}, {'_account_id': 6962, 'name': 'Kashyap Chamarthy', 'email': 'kchamart@redhat.com', 'username': 'kashyapc'}, {'_account_id': 7730, 'name': 'Sahid Orentino Ferdjaoui', 'email': 'sahid.ferdjaoui@industrialdiscipline.com', 'username': 'sahid'}, {'_account_id': 8864, 'name': 'Artom Lifshitz', 'email': 'alifshit@redhat.com', 'username': 'artom'}, {'_account_id': 10068, 'name': 'Welcome, new contributor!', 'username': 'welcome-message'}, {'_account_id': 15334, 'name': 'Stephen Finucane', 'display_name': 'stephenfin', 'email': 'stephenfin@redhat.com', 'username': 'sfinucan'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23312, 'name': 'kangyufei', 'email': 'kangyf@inspur.com', 'username': 'kangyufei'}, {'_account_id': 26006, 'name': 'Zack Cornelius', 'email': 'zack.cornelius@kove.net', 'username': 'zcornelius'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 26006, 'date': '2018-04-23 17:16:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2018-04-23 17:17:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2018-04-23 17:30:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(13 comments)

Thanks Zack, solid start to this!'}, {'account_id': 8864, 'date': '2018-04-23 17:38:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(4 comments)

As Dan said, nice start, thanks for proposing this. Some wonderings inline :)'}, {'account_id': 8864, 'date': '2018-04-23 17:43:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2018-04-23 17:44:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2018-04-23 18:03:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

While it might indeed be reasonable to run VMs on memory that is provided by NVMe SSDs, equating RAM and NVMe memory is problematic. I really think that the way that NVMe memory is represented should be different (either using a trait like the STORAGE_DISK_SSD trait) or a different resource class.'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2018-04-23 18:26:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> While it might indeed be reasonable to run VMs on memory that is
 > provided by NVMe SSDs, equating RAM and NVMe memory is problematic.
 > I really think that the way that NVMe memory is represented should
 > be different (either using a trait like the STORAGE_DISK_SSD trait)
 > or a different resource class.

This is not for general purpose NVMe support. This is specifically for backing instance memory by a device that looks like a disk. STORAGE_* is not appropriate for this as it has nothing to do with actual storage.'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2018-04-23 18:28:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2018-04-23 19:05:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

> > While it might indeed be reasonable to run VMs on memory that is
 > > provided by NVMe SSDs, equating RAM and NVMe memory is
 > problematic.
 > > I really think that the way that NVMe memory is represented
 > should
 > > be different (either using a trait like the STORAGE_DISK_SSD
 > trait)
 > > or a different resource class.
 > 
 > This is not for general purpose NVMe support. This is specifically
 > for backing instance memory by a device that looks like a disk.
 > STORAGE_* is not appropriate for this as it has nothing to do with
 > actual storage.

Note that I wasn't suggesting using the STORAGE_DISK_SSD trait. I was merely saying that we'd either need a different resource class or a new trait *like* the STORAGE_DISK_SSD trait which is used to indicate a better class for disk storage)."}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2018-04-23 19:38:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2018-04-23 19:54:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

Friggin gerrit web UI... I can't get the comment box to stay open in the browser to respond to you inline, Dan.

In any case, I'd totally missed that line in the Alternatives section. Thanks for pointing it out.

My concerns about the placement-specific aspects of this (resource classes and traits) are resolved.

I still share your concern about details involved in the migration process, though. So, ++ on getting more info on that."}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2018-04-23 20:06:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 26006, 'date': '2018-04-23 23:46:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 8864, 'date': '2018-04-24 00:29:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)

Nit about testing, don't think it's worth the -1"}, {'account_id': 6962, 'date': '2018-04-24 12:06:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2018-04-24 13:41:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 8864, 'date': '2018-04-24 16:59:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(11 comments)

Bunch of nits, and a question about scheduling and performance.'}, {'account_id': 26006, 'date': '2018-04-25 15:55:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(2 comments)

Response to a few comments / questions'}, {'account_id': 8864, 'date': '2018-04-25 17:20:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)

Still -1 because of the nits, but I've finally understood what this spec is about, so +1 as soon as the nits are addressed :)"}, {'account_id': 26006, 'date': '2018-04-25 18:59:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 8864, 'date': '2018-04-25 19:55:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

I'm onboard with this. I'm not authoritative on live migration, so I'm deferring to Kashyap for that, but everything else has been clearly explained and addressed. Thanks Zack!"}, {'account_id': 23312, 'date': '2018-04-26 08:50:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 8864, 'date': '2018-05-11 15:36:48.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from bp/s to bp/file-backed-memory'}, {'account_id': 7730, 'date': '2018-05-14 12:53:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

I don't think we should silently update the allocation_ratio value and I'm not sure it's necessary to have 2 options to tweak that to enable the feature."}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2018-05-14 13:44:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 26006, 'date': '2018-05-14 19:53:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 26006, 'date': '2018-05-14 20:00:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 26006, 'date': '2018-05-14 20:24:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2018-05-14 20:27:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 7730, 'date': '2018-05-15 07:19:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: Code-Review-1

(3 comments)

I can live with the two options even If i think we could simplifying by using only one. But I really don't like the override allocation_ratio in driver, can you consider the other way?"}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2018-05-15 12:30:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

(4 comments)

Couple notes inline for you to address. Otherwise, I'm +1 on the concept and the proposed implementation.

Best,

-jay"}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2018-05-15 12:33:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review-1

(4 comments)'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2018-05-15 16:40:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2018-05-15 18:07:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 26006, 'date': '2018-05-15 19:38:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2018-05-15 23:15:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 26006, 'date': '2018-05-16 15:51:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 7730, 'date': '2018-05-17 07:44:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review+1

Nice work Zack, thanks.'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2018-05-17 14:42:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8: Code-Review+1

(2 comments)

Good, well scoped out spec. It seems everyone's comments are addressed and I can't fault anything here"}, {'account_id': 8864, 'date': '2018-05-17 19:25:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8: Code-Review-1

I think I've thought of a thing significant enough to -1 this :(

Consider this sequence of events:

1. file_backed_memory is disabled
2. Some instances (called them group A) are booted
3. file_backed_memory is turned on
4. Some more instances, group B, are booted

The compute host now has A and B using system RAM and file backed memory, respectively. Is that acceptable? Since we're blocking live migration from older computes that don't know about file_backed_memory, it looks like the answer is no. Also, what sort of RAM usage will be reported in such a case?

One potential solution would be to have a tool (nova-manage subcommand?) to convert all VMs on a host to file_backed_memory (is this even possible from a libvirt POV though, especially without stopping the VMs?). This would also simplify the older (without file_backed) to newer (with file_backed) live migration case, since we could just live migrate the VM as is, and then convert it to file_backed in a separate step. Live migration is an admin operation, and they presumably have nova-manage access."}, {'account_id': 26006, 'date': '2018-05-17 23:51:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

> I think I've thought of a thing significant enough to -1 this :(
 > 
 > Consider this sequence of events:
 > 
 > 1. file_backed_memory is disabled
 > 2. Some instances (called them group A) are booted
 > 3. file_backed_memory is turned on
 > 4. Some more instances, group B, are booted
 > 
 > The compute host now has A and B using system RAM and file backed
 > memory, respectively. Is that acceptable? Since we're blocking live
 > migration from older computes that don't know about
 > file_backed_memory, it looks like the answer is no. Also, what sort
 > of RAM usage will be reported in such a case?

Dan and Jay had a similar conversation on line 56 of Patch Set 1.

The summary there is this is a similar situation as changing the storage config and restarting the service while instances are running, which would result in some instances running on the old config, and some on the new, and the storage utilization reported strangely as a result.

We could check for this at startup (go through running instances at startup, and warn if any are configured mismatched to the config file), but we don't currently do this for storage configuration, as one example.

 > 
 > One potential solution would be to have a tool (nova-manage
 > subcommand?) to convert all VMs on a host to file_backed_memory (is
 > this even possible from a libvirt POV though, especially without
 > stopping the VMs?). This would also simplify the older (without
 > file_backed) to newer (with file_backed) live migration case, since
 > we could just live migrate the VM as is, and then convert it to
 > file_backed in a separate step. Live migration is an admin
 > operation, and they presumably have nova-manage access."}, {'account_id': 8864, 'date': '2018-05-18 00:23:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8: Code-Review+1

> Dan and Jay had a similar conversation on line 56 of Patch Set 1.

Ah, apologies. I looked through the previous comments to make sure what I was about to say hadn't already been said, but I clearly didn't look hard enough :)

I think I'm OK with the spec as written, then."}, {'account_id': 6962, 'date': '2018-05-18 09:44:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 7730, 'date': '2018-05-18 14:55:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2018-05-21 17:16:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review+2

(1 comment)

This seems like a fairly standard libvirt feature enablement and has gotten quite a bit of review from libvirty people.'}, {'account_id': 26006, 'date': '2018-05-21 17:38:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2018-05-21 17:46:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6962, 'date': '2018-05-22 06:54:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review+1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 7730, 'date': '2018-05-25 12:17:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

Do it. :)

commit_message:
Libvirt file backed memory

Spec for blueprint libvirt-file-backed-memory
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/libvirt-file-backed-memory

With the advent of large capacity memory devices, it's now reasonable to run
virtual machines with file backed memory. This enables a much larger total
memory area per compute node

Change-Id: I99304f6c5f9c436efe25d0ab016c5d50e90f3e22
Signed-off-by: Zack Cornelius <zack.cornelius@kove.net>

Commit e49688be9844b9ae32e14747ad95a07be0fa142c
introduced filters for ephemeral firewall rules
managed by Ironic Inspectors iptables PXE filter.
These new filters cause duplicate entries in the
persisted firewall rules.

sed expression '/-m comment --comment/p' was used
to ensure the ironic-inspector api port is not

to be written.

This change enhances the expression to check for

commit_message:
Fix duplicate entries in /etc/sysconfig/iptables

Commit e49688be9844b9ae32e14747ad95a07be0fa142c
introduced filters for ephemeral firewall rules
managed by Ironic Inspectors iptables PXE filter.
These new filters cause duplicate entries in the
persisted firewall rules.

sed expression '/-m comment --comment/p' was used
to ensure the ironic-inspector api port is not
accidentally removed. But the expression also
matches several other entries causing duplicates
to be written.

This change enhances the expression to check for
'-m comment --comment' and 'ironic-inspector'.

Related-Bug: #1771128
Change-Id: I6ac397e786f66e33c523edb94613181040c15f19

commit_message:
Add cAdvisor for Prometheus monitoring

cAdvisor (Container Advisor) provides metrics on resource usage and
performance characteristics of running containers.  This change
deploys a cadvisor container and configures prometheus to scrape
data from it.

Change-Id: I55dd4fee954f9be68efda397746861ddaaa0a565
Partially-Implements: blueprint prometheus

commit_message:
Use upper constraints when installing ARA

Currently the installation of ARA does not apply
the same pip options (including constraints, proxy
settings, etc) as the ansible bootstrap. This may
result in unexpected side-effects.

To ensure that we're keeping things consistent, we
apply the same pip options as those used for the
Ansible bootstrap.

Backport note:
We include the os_rally role requirement to ensure
that the repo build is able to complete.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/570928
Change-Id: I5f20a130032e1b65dc78828344345515975da4dc
(cherry picked from commit f4e8e7f82a94379bc50779e9027876bce23d3a90)

subject: Update os_rally role SHA for cmd2 package pin
messages: [{'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-05-29 19:10:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2018-05-30 01:02:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 13095, 'date': '2018-05-30 12:30:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-29 19:10:07.000000000', 'message': "Update os_rally role SHA for cmd2 package pin

The cmd2-0.9.0 is python3-only and the rally venv is built
unconstrained, so it's trying to bring in the latest version
which is incompatible with python2. We pin the library to
ensure that the venv build completes correctly.

Change-Id: I5f20a130032e1b65dc78828344345515975da4dc
"}]
commit_message:
Update os_rally role SHA for cmd2 package pin

The cmd2-0.9.0 is python3-only and the rally venv is built
unconstrained, so it's trying to bring in the latest version
which is incompatible with python2. We pin the library to
ensure that the venv build completes correctly.

Change-Id: I5f20a130032e1b65dc78828344345515975da4dc

commit_message:
Use upper constraints when installing ARA

Currently the installation of ARA does not apply
the same pip options (including constraints, proxy
settings, etc) as the ansible bootstrap. This may
result in unexpected side-effects.

To ensure that we're keeping things consistent, we
apply the same pip options as those used for the
Ansible bootstrap.

Backport note:
We include the os_rally role requirement to ensure
that the repo build is able to complete.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/570929
Change-Id: I5f20a130032e1b65dc78828344345515975da4dc
(cherry picked from commit f4e8e7f82a94379bc50779e9027876bce23d3a90)

commit_message:
Fix image push for python3

Rework push_image function to use docker client push function with decode=True, to decode automatically to dict.

Change-Id: I28d38e968c3809a1074347271e49dc07dc861f11
Closes-Bug: 1771514

http://cdn.pasteraw.com/5knqn07hfwmz1qqt80brged0xiuzuk'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2016-11-18 14:23:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 15: Code-Review-1

As discussed:

[14:03:19] odyssey4me:	logan- argh re https://review.openstack.org/396821
[14:03:24] logan-:	yeah
[14:03:39] 	jbadiapa (~jubapa@105.red-2-139-219.staticip.rima-tde.net) joined the channel
[14:03:41] 	fguillot (~fguillot@2607:f748:9:1678:c52:5934:6da2:a5f3) joined the channel
[14:04:34] odyssey4me:	maybe our only recourse here is to add a known issue, and a docs entry somewhere, which states that distro package updates for nova compute nodes, specifically for that package, must be done by the playbook in order to maintain the links
[14:05:25] odyssey4me:	I can't decide whether this is worth it all though - it seems far better to add a known issue stating that the version of libvirt between the repo server and the compute nodes must be the same... then avoid all the linking altogether.
[14:05:29] logan-:	we could pin the distro package
[14:06:11] odyssey4me:	pinning is something we did in juno, it ended badly
[14:06:20] logan-:	i wonder if the linking should default to off, and maybe it should be part of the upgrade process to enable it and then disable it at the end
[14:06:24] odyssey4me:	ubuntu pulls packages more than 5 revisions back
[14:06:58] logan-:	ie we don't support mixed envs but we'll accommodate it during the upgrade
[14:06:58] odyssey4me:	well, that's why I was thinking about some sort of detection for the wrong version of libvirt being there
[14:07:22] odyssey4me:	if your libvirt differs from the repo server libvirt, then link - otherwise carry on
[14:07:31] logan-:	hmm yeah
[14:08:00] logan-:	that's maybe possible with the .egg-info file
[14:08:24] odyssey4me:	hmm, well - if you can figure out a way to make that happen then that sounds like a perfect option

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-30 12:19:29.000000000', 'message': "Only setup rabbitmq when the inventory group is present

With the merge of https://review.openstack.org/569061 the
roles which do not have the rabbitmq_all group are failing
with messages like:

'dict object' has no attribute 'rabbitmq_all'

This patch ensures that the tasks are only activated if the
inventory group is present and populated.

Change-Id: I8f9004147753bb7f8121e344379417a6d6e2e807
"}]
commit_message:
Only setup rabbitmq when the inventory group is present

With the merge of https://review.openstack.org/569061 the
roles which do not have the rabbitmq_all group are failing
with messages like:

'dict object' has no attribute 'rabbitmq_all'

This patch ensures that the tasks are only activated if the
inventory group is present and populated.

Change-Id: I8f9004147753bb7f8121e344379417a6d6e2e807

commit_message:
doc: Don't use single backticks in man pages

This is done in a couple of places in the documentation and is broken
rST. 'prog' is semantic markup that fits right in here, so use that.

Change-Id: Ic654e33daaf68b01f561ac8d792934d5a57a07e5

[{'created': '2018-03-26 06:55:46.000000000', 'message': "Update image in magnum jobs

In current magnum job failures, magnum is trying
to use an image that doesn't exist and therefore it
can't find an image property. The following error is
the result: BadRequest: Cluster type (vm, Unset, swarm)
not supported (HTTP 400).

Change-Id: I399c647fbf67236bdfa2a7a09ef63cd0c5df8b26
"}]
commit_message:
Update image in magnum jobs

In current magnum job failures, magnum is trying
to use an image that doesn't exist and therefore it
can't find an image property. The following error is
the result: BadRequest: Cluster type (vm, Unset, swarm)
not supported (HTTP 400).

Change-Id: I399c647fbf67236bdfa2a7a09ef63cd0c5df8b26

commit_message:
Put upper limit on cmd2 in kolla-toolbox

This fixes an issue with cmd2 >= 0.9.0 requiring python3.

commit_message:
Set default application for Ceph Luminous openstack_pools

Luminous can assign application types to pools and ceph-ansible
supports this, provided it is passed an appropriate list of maps.
The list of maps is defined in openstack_pools and this change
updates this variable to contain the correct default application
type.

Includes update to environments/disable-telemetry.yaml so that
the GnocchiRbdPool is not created if telemetry is disabled.

Change-Id: I3966a8a1b170202e020684a36ecece78599296b5
Closes-Bug: #1772743

commit_message:
Add undercloud_prep_containers.log to logs

Undercloud deployment has been switched to containers. Extra logs should be
tracked. This patch adds undercloud_prep_containers.log to the list to be able
to track failures with image upload.

Change-Id: Ibe108cda0e22599d8edc481896b3245eb12dfb51

commit_message:
tempest: healthmonitor is deleted via resource_cleanup

No need for an explicit cleanup. Explicit cleanup of monitors deleted by
resource_cleanup causes tempest tests to fail

Change-Id: I3f6c53bb23bc4fd84581b18ec847d52ade3d1ac6
Closes-bug: 1709602

commit_message:
Remove mox in tests/unit/api/openstack/compute

Replace mox with mock or stub_out in the following files
in nova/tests/unit/api/openstack/compute directory.

* admin_only_action_common.py
* test_admin_actions.py
* test_lock_server.py
* test_migrate_server.py
* test_pause_server.py
* test_suspend_server.py

Change-Id: I83b473e9ba557545b5c186f979e068e442de2424
Implements: blueprint mox-removal

commit_message:
fix "identity_uri" in install document

With the removal of the v2 API, keystone can be run on the same port
for all interfaces.
for more information.see[0][1]
[0]https://docs.openstack.org/keystone/latest/install/keystone-install-rdo.html#install-and-configure-components
[1]https://docs.openstack.org/keystone/latest/contributor/http-api.html

Change-Id: I2e1d971eeb2e1a9bece0037123da97d761244f4b

commit_message:
check cron container error

In common role, when check common container for cron restart,
we should use cron_container.changed instead of
check_common_containers.changed

Change-Id: Ifaaa437f5e205e970371fbb3660b68df352eb440
Closes-Bug: #1773923

commit_message:
add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Change-Id: Ia39c706f6a817deb3b94a1430b3e505f9c098384
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Put upper limit on cmd2 in kolla-toolbox

This fixes an issue with cmd2 >= 0.9.0 requiring python3.

Change-Id: I08b606980cb796a6b884e69b3e6749edbdd7cf37
Closes-Bug: #1773938

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-15 01:41:27.000000000', 'message': 'Only enable the default backend for ocata+

When deploying on icehouse with Ceph, the RBD backend is
configured globally, but cinder sets enabled_backends to "LVM",
which exists (and is wrong to boot).

This commit moves the check for empty "backends" under the ocata
check.  Per comment #5 on LP:1719742: "The cinder-volume service
fails to start in ocata+ if enable-backends is not set."

Closes-Bug: #1753611

Change-Id: I07a9f9c739064bc93870a1f8f68a7624b7ce3033
Signed-off-by: Craige McWhirter <craige@mcwhirter.io>

commit_message:
Only enable the default backend for ocata+

When deploying on icehouse with Ceph, the RBD backend is
configured globally, but cinder sets enabled_backends to "LVM",
which exists (and is wrong to boot).

This commit moves the check for empty "backends" under the ocata
check.  Per comment #5 on LP:1719742: "The cinder-volume service
fails to start in ocata+ if enable-backends is not set."

Closes-Bug: #1753611

Change-Id: I07a9f9c739064bc93870a1f8f68a7624b7ce3033
Signed-off-by: Craige McWhirter <craige@mcwhirter.io>

commit_message:
Filter disabled service for Chance Filter

When use chance filter, it filters down node and chooses
randomly. Maybe it is better to filter disable node.

Change-Id: If2384090e58c30f9f6c2238db42958e61024b492

Unblock gate

Add kolla-toolbox and sensu-base to skip list to unblock gate. Then we
can merge the proper fix and remove the images from skip list.

Related-Bug: #1773938

commit_message:
Freeze cmd2 library temporarilly

In need of landing changes before release and the upstream gate is
wedged at the moment.

Root of the issue is a release blunder by a upstream dependency:
https://github.com/python-cmd2/cmd2/issues/421

Upstream has made the same change to global requirements here:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/570811

We can remove this again as soon as changes propagate out to all
dependencies.

Change-Id: Ib002d4534150c9c2aba025decfd0faef77f71297

commit_message:
Document how to disable notifications

This adds information to the "notification_format" config
option help and notifications docs on how to disable notifications.

While updating the config option help text, a stale reference
to Pike is removed.

Change-Id: I736025a0a88fc969831558805687b642da8cd365
Closes-Bug: #1761405
(cherry picked from commit 11528966ba000addde5416f085332e0d39c46588)
(cherry picked from commit c0db837835438f89a10e2dfb130db2f39cb18477)

Remove moxstubout usage

In newer versions of oslotest, moxstubout will be deprecated.
So we can get out in front of the curve now and remove it.

commit_message:
add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Co-Authored-By: Nguyen Hai <nguyentrihai93@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I4556b7d0d4aab52188e873ec84b9f30ba8e6a0c1
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

messages:
[{'account_id': 23163, 'date': '2018-05-18 16:16:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 9061, 'date': '2018-05-28 17:00:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

For CentOS, it looks like there's a conflict because of EPEL: http://logs.openstack.org/57/569457/1/check/openstack-ansible-functional-distro_install-centos-7-nv/1fd5703/logs/ara-report/result/fb64d7b7-e9b5-4afc-8add-384ff70d7955/

    Error: Package: python2-qpid-proton-0.21.0-3.el7.x86_64 (epel)
              Requires: libqpid-proton.so.11()(64bit)
    Error: Package: python2-qpid-proton-0.21.0-3.el7.x86_64 (epel)
              Requires: qpid-proton-c(x86-64) = 0.21.0-3.el7
              Available: qpid-proton-c-0.14.0-2.el7.x86_64 (extras)
                  qpid-proton-c(x86-64) = 0.14.0-2.el7
              Available: qpid-proton-c-0.17.0-4.el7.x86_64 (openstack-queens)
                  qpid-proton-c(x86-64) = 0.17.0-4.el7"}, {'account_id': 9061, 'date': '2018-05-29 00:54:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1'}, {'account_id': 9061, 'date': '2018-05-29 00:55:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Can you let us know why you need EPEL enabled on the centos-7 deployment ? If there's a package that RDO doesn't provide, we can fix that."}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-05-29 08:18:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

@David IIRC EPEL is required for uwsgi and perhaps nginx too, both of which we use. I'm not sure if there are other packages, but those are ones we discussed in the past. We would love to get rid of the EPEL repo requirement!"}, {'account_id': 23163, 'date': '2018-05-29 08:30:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1
Hi David,

The EPEL dependency is not being added in this review so it shouldn't block it I think"}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-05-29 10:18:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

LGTM - working out the EPEL/RDO conflicts will take some time and doesn't need to hold this patch back."}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-05-30 09:26:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

let's merge it and continue."}]

[{'created': '2018-05-18 16:16:35.000000000', 'message': 'Add support for using distribution packages for OpenStack services

Distributions provide packages for the OpenStack services so we add
support for using these instead of the pip ones.

Change-Id: Iab155254fa3600e1b6b3e8992f7c1fdc6f710ed6
Implements: blueprint openstack-distribution-packages
'}]
commit_message:
Add support for using distribution packages for OpenStack services

Distributions provide packages for the OpenStack services so we add
support for using these instead of the pip ones.

Change-Id: Iab155254fa3600e1b6b3e8992f7c1fdc6f710ed6
Implements: blueprint openstack-distribution-packages

commit_message:
Add support for using distribution packages for OpenStack services

Distributions provide packages for the OpenStack services so we add
support for using these instead of the pip ones.

Change-Id: I3edabacc3978cd42988a6c0c04a011c22159b9fa
Implements: blueprint openstack-distribution-packages

Put upper limit on cmd2 in kolla-toolbox

This fixes an issue with cmd2 >= 0.9.0 requiring python3.

Closes-Bug: #1773938

Add support for using distribution packages for OpenStack services

Distributions provide packages for the OpenStack services so we add
support for using these instead of the pip ones.

Change-Id: I2435793b73e0a30131b4710b6e7d29dacbb7e6fa
Implements: blueprint openstack-distribution-packages

[{'created': '2018-05-23 10:49:49.000000000', 'message': "defaults: Allow uwsgi to autoload required plugins.

Distributions normally package uwsgi in a modular fashion so we need
to be use the 'autoload' option to allow it to load all the required
plugins.

Change-Id: I11750219ef70549b1769bede406d6bdda097b6c2
Implements: blueprint openstack-distribution-packages
"}]
commit_message:
defaults: Allow uwsgi to autoload required plugins.

Distributions normally package uwsgi in a modular fashion so we need
to be use the 'autoload' option to allow it to load all the required
plugins.

Change-Id: I11750219ef70549b1769bede406d6bdda097b6c2
Implements: blueprint openstack-distribution-packages

commit_message:
To avoid creating empty volume for heat

1. when set heat_dev_mode to no, the volume will be empty[0],
this ps to avoid creating empty volume.

[0]: https://github.com/openstack/kolla-ansible/blob/master/ansible/roles/heat/defaults/main.yml#L13

Change-Id: Id22469442a4713f53646ffec2c5a960722fccb44

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-29 18:42:34.000000000', 'message': 'add a validation step to check README.rst parsing for PyPI

PyPI is now more strict about requiring README.rst files to be
parseable. Failures to parse the readme block uploading new versions
of packages. To detect these errors in advance, we should validate the
README formatting as part of validating a release.

Change-Id: I416befcf3e47818680018394fa63de8983351587
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
add a validation step to check README.rst parsing for PyPI

PyPI is now more strict about requiring README.rst files to be
parseable. Failures to parse the readme block uploading new versions
of packages. To detect these errors in advance, we should validate the
README formatting as part of validating a release.

Change-Id: I416befcf3e47818680018394fa63de8983351587
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

the README.rst and moves the old README.rst to the documentation readme.

commit_message:
Fix documentations for pypi

The readme included references to docs files which do not exist outside
of the built documentation. This change removes the extra docs bit for
the README.rst and moves the old README.rst to the documentation readme.

Change-Id: Ic00ca2ccfd66348f6b1d367a55b6318b82849f59

[{'created': '2018-05-07 22:00:22.000000000', 'message': "Parameterized deployment hosts

In order to make the deployment more flexible, we should allow for the
ansible hosts to be configurable from the old undercloud/overcloud
concepts. Rather than assume 'undercloud'/'overcloud', we should allow
for these to include the same set of hosts.  This change introduces
'deployment_hosts' and 'deployment_target_hosts' variables that can be
used to control where the tasks are run on.

commit_message:
Parameterized deployment hosts

In order to make the deployment more flexible, we should allow for the
ansible hosts to be configurable from the old undercloud/overcloud
concepts. Rather than assume 'undercloud'/'overcloud', we should allow
for these to include the same set of hosts.  This change introduces
'deployment_source_hosts' and 'deployment_target_hosts' variables that
can be used to control where the tasks are run on.

Change-Id: I249cc7e179bc1423788aab967c4b2e3f9ffc81d4
Related-Blueprint: all-in-one

commit_message:
Remove support for classic drivers

They are deprecated and will be removed from Ironic. A similar change
was already done to the containerized undercloud.

Change-Id: If442f103adc03ec97f9e995d5e2bc47dfc097f90

commit_message:
Use the standard messaging in the baremetal workbook

Update the baremetal workbook to use the standard message sending
workflow. This workflow reduces the boilerplate that is copied between
workflows by defining the message structure, providing the retry logic
and ensuring the task on a "FAILED" message.

The workflow also offers optional persistence in Swift. If the plan name
is given to the workflow it will store the messages in a Swift container
named <plan_name>-messages.

Related-Bug: #1757372
Change-Id: I1665ae56a88557bdb8459651021185cfb9fd1a8f

changed the Depends-On to work with RDO Zuul version.'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2018-05-02 16:36:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

Good catch. You don't really need Depends-On, things should work without it already."}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2018-05-08 18:57:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

In conversations with TheJulia a couple weeks ago, I learned that triple-o (I believe the undercloud provisioning part of triple-o at least) does not (want to) use the required-since-Pike Ironic node resource class-based scheduling. I'm not entirely sure why this is the case (Emilien, pls advise), but if this is true, I'm pretty sure the undercloud provisioning system at least in triple-o will continue to depend on ironic host manager scheduler manager.

Thoughts?

-jay"}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2018-05-09 07:55:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Hi Jay,

> I learned that triple-o (I believe the undercloud provisioning part of triple-o at least) does not (want to) use the required-since-Pike Ironic node resource class-based scheduling

That's not quite the case. I personally updated the undercloud code to always configure one default resource class ("baremetal") for all nodes and all managed flavors. We may want to check that FFU work correctly, but everything else should be covered.'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2018-05-09 08:09:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 7144, 'date': '2018-05-29 21:07:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Remove ironic_host_manager usage

The baremetal scheduling options were deprecated
in Pike and the ironic_host_manager was deprecated
in Queens and has now been removed. Deployments
must use resource classes now for baremetal scheduling.

Depends-On: I695b250c82c8dcedcd8e2bee00c56bb2df19212c
Change-Id: I5902a07cb9869cebbbabc3f00df9ea819a2eea6b

sure blazar passes lint tests.

This reverts commit a5b35ebf116830f2b464714760c4ccd274b99d30,
effectively re-enabling zuul jobs, and adapts the role
to our latest standards (The lint tests were failing, as
the passwords were logged while setting up Blazar server)

Functional testing starts with -nv only. However, in this
commit we added the necessary `rabbitmq_all` group to
the infra1 group, to help further functional testing.

Co-Authored-By: Taseer Ahmed <taseer94@gmail.com>
Change-Id: Ic2560b53aebf69e4784ce56db6929fe010e6b11e

commit_message:
Add blazar base jobs

This introduces the most basic jobs for blazar, and makes
sure blazar passes lint tests.

This reverts commit a5b35ebf116830f2b464714760c4ccd274b99d30,
effectively re-enabling zuul jobs, and adapts the role
to our latest standards (The lint tests were failing, as
the passwords were logged while setting up Blazar server)

Functional testing starts with -nv only. However, in this
commit we added the necessary `rabbitmq_all` group to
the infra1 group, to help further functional testing.

Co-Authored-By: Taseer Ahmed <taseer94@gmail.com>
Change-Id: Ic2560b53aebf69e4784ce56db6929fe010e6b11e

Fix postinstall for npm job

npm jobs uses python3.5, but pip uses python2.7 to install horizon.
This fixes this issue.

commit_message:
Register pipeline conf in quuens+

A bug was causing the events yaml from being rendered on quuens+
deploys. This change adds it to the quuens+ configs.

Closes-Bug: 1773355
Change-Id: I309107da609e186638332d3a9bca00a86ccd6010

commit_message:
Fix postinstall for npm job

npm jobs uses python3.5, but pip uses python2.7 to install horizon.
This fixes this issue.
