messages:
[{'account_id': 21151, 'date': '2018-03-17 01:15:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 21151, 'date': '2018-03-17 05:50:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I know we're trying to solve pre FFU ovs update[1], but this is for a general major upgrade from p->q, where some config changes are not applied with ovs package update.
for FFU case, this maybe a duplication with[1].


[1]:https://review.openstack.org/#/c/540443/"}, {'account_id': 18575, 'date': '2018-03-19 06:49:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

I am still skeptical of this change add it as part of the upgrade as I have not analyzed the impact of changing the ownership of existing files of a running service. It requires testing and confirmations from ovs team. If it really has impact on changing ownership of currently used files, the best way is to apply this change is introducing a service to run on reboot before ovs to ensure the changes are applied.'}, {'account_id': 18575, 'date': '2018-03-19 06:49:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1'}, {'account_id': 21151, 'date': '2018-03-19 07:07:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

> (1 comment)
 > 
 > I am still skeptical of this change add it as part of the upgrade
 > as I have not analyzed the impact of changing the ownership of
 > existing files of a running service. It requires testing and
 > confirmations from ovs team. If it really has impact on changing
 > ownership of currently used files, the best way is to apply this
 > change is introducing a service to run on reboot before ovs to
 > ensure the changes are applied.

There is an issue with current upgrade_tasks when it runs rpm replace shell cmd[1]: the rpm scriptlet will change the ownership of /etc/openvswitch file to openvswitch:openvswitch unconditionally, but at the time of ovs-2.8 package update, the openvswitch user is not created which causes a Warning that the ownership is not properly set.
maybe we could add the user/group creation, config file(/etc/openvswitch, /etc/sysconfig/openvswitch) changes in these upgrade tasks, and leave the file ownership changes to a service which be applied during reboot.

[1]:rpm -U --test {{item}} 2>&1 | grep "already installed" || rpm -U --replacepkgs --notriggerun --nopostun {{item}};'}, {'account_id': 21151, 'date': '2018-03-19 07:32:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

if /etc/sysconfig/openvswitch is configured to include OVS_USER_ID being at 'openvswitch:hugetlbfs', then the next time ovs is restarted or node is rebooted, the owership configuration will be automatically applied to those files(/var/run/openvswitch). since we also configure qemu in the hugetlbfs group, then we need to make sure that libvirtd and openvswitch service are restarted together in order for the two to join the hugetlbfs group at the same time. reboot will certainly do this, but if one of the service has to restart before rebooting, then it needs the other be restarted as well."}, {'account_id': 6133, 'date': '2018-03-19 07:43:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6133, 'date': '2018-03-20 12:40:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: -Code-Review

Part of the problem of ovs overwriting config was caused by https://review.openstack.org/554499'}, {'account_id': 21151, 'date': '2018-03-22 02:07:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 21151, 'date': '2018-03-22 03:25:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 21151, 'date': '2018-03-22 04:02:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 6133, 'date': '2018-03-22 10:35:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 21151, 'date': '2018-03-22 10:45:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 21151, 'date': '2018-03-22 10:46:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 6133, 'date': '2018-03-22 10:59:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 8297, 'date': '2018-03-22 11:12:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

(3 comments)

I'm quite surprised by the necessity to create an user to upgrade openvswitch ... that should be handled by packaging.

Beside that, we can safely remove the ignore error, and the rest LGTM."}, {'account_id': 8297, 'date': '2018-03-22 12:12:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 21151, 'date': '2018-03-22 13:30:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 21151, 'date': '2018-03-22 13:30:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(2 comments)

Thanks for the review!'}, {'account_id': 6133, 'date': '2018-03-22 15:10:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 11391, 'date': '2018-03-22 16:07:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 6133, 'date': '2018-03-23 15:50:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 8297, 'date': '2018-03-23 16:15:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

Wondering out loud what would happen if ovs was updated during minor update ?'}, {'account_id': 6133, 'date': '2018-03-23 16:24:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Yes, we are right. It will come as part of minor update now'}, {'account_id': 6133, 'date': '2018-03-23 16:29:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

More concerns... real use case is that people are going to be on 10, and they will get ovs 2.9 as part of minor update. But those templates won't be there for 10. Shall we backport that from queens back to newton, passing through all releases?"}, {'account_id': 6133, 'date': '2018-03-24 09:35:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: -Code-Review

I did some test in OSP, going from ovs 2.6 to 2.9
The update is possible without any error. The main problem is that as user/group is not created, and the ovs config file is not changed, ovs continues running as root. What are the problems of ovs running as root, is that acceptable? Will it cause problems regarding dpdk?'}, {'account_id': 21151, 'date': '2018-03-26 11:30:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

> More concerns... real use case is that people are going to be on
 > 10, and they will get ovs 2.9 as part of minor update. But those
 > templates won't be there for 10. Shall we backport that from queens
 > back to newton, passing through all releases?

I think we will still need the ovs_update part from review[1] to do special configuration of ovs when updating to 2.9 during minor update process, but removing FFUOpenvswitchRepo config.

[1]:https://review.openstack.org/#/c/540443"}, {'account_id': 11391, 'date': '2018-03-26 16:02:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: -Code-Review'}, {'account_id': 21151, 'date': '2018-03-28 05:52:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 21151, 'date': '2018-03-28 05:53:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Re-add the creation of openvswitch user.'}, {'account_id': 6133, 'date': '2018-04-03 07:30:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+1

This looks good as first step. However, we need to do more things: change /etc/sysconfig/openvswitch file, and also change permissions of openvswitch folders. This can be done in next patches'}, {'account_id': 6133, 'date': '2018-04-03 07:31:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: -Code-Review

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 21151, 'date': '2018-04-03 08:15:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 6133, 'date': '2018-04-03 08:26:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 18575, 'date': '2018-04-04 10:40:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6133, 'date': '2018-04-05 12:08:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 21151, 'date': '2018-04-14 04:02:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 21151, 'date': '2018-04-14 04:06:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

Removing openvswitch user and hugetlbfs tasks as it's not needed in master which already have ovs updated to 2.8+. it will be added in lower versions like newton/ocata/pike."}, {'account_id': 18575, 'date': '2018-04-16 12:19:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6133, 'date': '2018-04-16 12:31:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 7144, 'date': '2018-05-29 21:04:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-17 01:15:29.000000000', 'message': 'Add ovs 2.8 upgrade tasks

Ovs 2.8 update requires several configuration changes
which will not be applied in normal upgrade process.
This patch is going to add special ansible tasks in
upgrade_tasks to configure those necessary changes.

Change-Id: I8f937848f0b6a50f16d9d581beac8c500c878d14

commit_message:
Add condition to ovs run during upgrade.

This add one conditonal:
 - check whether ovs package needs upgrade

This prevents unnecessary run of a block of
ovs tasks.

Co-Authored-By: Yolanda Robla Mota <yroblamo@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I8f937848f0b6a50f16d9d581beac8c500c878d14

Fix postinstall for npm job

This fixes this issue.

commit_message:
Remove ignore D000 in validation code

This commit going to remove --ignore D000 which had raised
alot of issues, such as:

subject: modified regiter tricircle api to keystone
messages:
[{'account_id': 28071, 'date': '2018-05-09 03:18:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2018-05-09 03:18:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 7233, 'date': '2018-05-09 07:15:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
Add lxc_net_manage_iptables variable

Added lxc_net_manage_iptables variable. Setting this variable avoids
duplcaiting the existing rules.

Change-Id: I76800d23929bd2a6f656a20095b7d2352a4757fa
(cherry picked from commit fff13e53d7741d7c284657489bcd347d567d5b39)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-24 12:53:31.000000000', 'message': 'Change RDO mapping for PyYAML

The previous PyYAML mapping used "PyYAML" as the Python package for
RDO. This does not work well with the singlespec macros, since they
keep the PyYAML package name for the python3 subpackage.

The package provides "python-yaml", and Fedora's python3-PyYAML also
provide python3-yaml, so this is a safe change.

Change-Id: I1c92888cf830b2ab5fdc154a0322e6e54d5712f7
'}, {'created': '2018-05-29 12:23:59.000000000', 'message': 'Change RDO mapping for PyYAML, pyparsing and pytz

The previous PyYAML mapping used "PyYAML" as the Python package for
RDO. This does not work well with the singlespec macros, since they
keep the PyYAML package name for the python3 subpackage.

The package provides "python-yaml", and Fedora's python3-PyYAML also
provide python3-yaml, so this is a safe change.

Similarly, we can remove the special mapping for pyparsing (we have
python2-pyparsing providing python-pyparsing in RDO) and pytz (the CentOS
package provides python-pytz).

Change-Id: I1c92888cf830b2ab5fdc154a0322e6e54d5712f7
'}]
commit_message:
Change RDO mapping for PyYAML, pyparsing and pytz

The previous PyYAML mapping used "PyYAML" as the Python package for
RDO. This does not work well with the singlespec macros, since they
keep the PyYAML package name for the python3 subpackage.

The package provides "python-yaml", and Fedora's python3-PyYAML also
provide python3-yaml, so this is a safe change.

Similarly, we can remove the special mapping for pyparsing (we have
python2-pyparsing providing python-pyparsing in RDO) and pytz (the CentOS
package provides python-pytz).

Change-Id: I1c92888cf830b2ab5fdc154a0322e6e54d5712f7

[{'account_id': 9656, 'date': '2018-01-23 23:46:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-01-24 05:52:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 23717, 'date': '2018-01-28 09:58:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 8652, 'date': '2018-02-06 11:17:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Thanks for adding a troubleshooting section and the note about the working directory cleanup. Could you please add that there is the `-X/--clean` option for quickstart.sh that can be used to clean it up before each run. It's actually a good idea to run like that and lets you avoid manually deleting it before runs.

That option is not default because there's the scary case of somebody unexperienced using `--working-dir /home/foo/` and accidentally wiping their entire home directory with a default cleanup. But having it in the troubleshooting section would be perfect."}, {'account_id': 9656, 'date': '2018-02-14 21:19:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 9656, 'date': '2018-02-14 21:19:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
Added a troubleshooting tip to clean up ~/.quickstart

I just wasted several days trying to figure out why introspection failed
in my setup with neutron authN issues in BMC node. I finally figured
that it's the same issue as bug 1706585, and the fix was to remove
~/.quickstart and start over.

Since current documentation doesn't have a page for troubleshooting tips
yet, this patch also creates one and attaches it to the bottom of the
index page.

Change-Id: I495b2063ca8b60d2fe396c776b38ea9d627831e9

commit_message:
Update auth_uri option to www_authenticate_uri

Option auth_uri from group keystone_authtoken is deprecated in Queens [1].
Use option www_authenticate_uri from group keystone_authtoken.

[1]https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508522/

Change-Id: I80b505feb611af8a95ac19f2808c73069e2a33e5
(cherry picked from commit bba6022af978d738d25bea9627cd83afe077916c)

[Docs - UC restore] Add missing command when refreshing certificates

We were missing to refresh overcloud-cacert.pem

commit_message:
Replace deprecated "auth_uri" by "www_authenticate_uri"

According to [1], "auth_uri" has been deprecated.
This patch replace it by using "www_authenticate_uri" instead.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508522

Change-Id: I3242394fd4ebfa7eda390be872372a53b5311a46
(cherry picked from commit 8a3358e2d13074b5bdb2a60028b7e6c440d2f935)

commit_message:
Replace port 35357 with 5000

Now that the v2.0 API has been removed, we don't have a reason to
include deployment instructions for two separate applications on
different ports.

Change-Id: I1023c6296598fb7266fcfcb7e842bbc14f9da16a

Replace port 35357 with 5000

Now that the v2.0 API has been removed, we don't have a reason to
include deployment instructions for two separate applications on
different ports.

commit_message:
Reraise exception with converting node ID

When a requested trait doesn't exist at trait deletion, the API
response contains an internal node ID, which shouldn't be exposed.
This patch reraises an exception with a node identifier specified to
the API.

Change-Id: I781a510b25fa7de735c97b4ed919dfcb3adbdd2c
Story: 2002062
Task: 19715

commit_message:
Update RHEL/CentOS horizon install instruction

openstack-dashboard.conf in openstack-dashboard package
for RHEL/CentOS does not contain WSGIApplicationGroup configuration
which is required to make the dashboard work correctly.

Replace port 35357 with 5000

Based on the change in Keystone Install Guide [1], this patch replace
port 35357 with 5000.

For more details, please check similar changes which have been done
on other projects: Nova [2], Neutron [3], Cinder [4], Glance [5].

commit_message:
Replace port 35357 with 5000

Now that the v2.0 API has been removed, we don't have a reason to
include deployment instructions for two separate applications on
different ports.

commit_message:
Remove unhelpful log message in copy middleware

We probably don't need an extra INFO-level message every time a user
makes a PUT request with X-Copy-From set. It's still in the proxy's
access logs.

Change-Id: I32ce8ff16cb296dd5acef07202a59bc5125111c1

commit_message:
add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Change-Id: I214404165597acc35f3b107d462d51bdeef813e3
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-25 12:43:54.000000000', 'message': "Merge default_listen with swift_proxy_server_listen_options

Currently haproxy for swift doesn't have default setting. This generates config
such as

  listen swift_proxy_server
  bind 10.0.0.5:13808 transparent ssl crt /etc/pki/tls/private/overcloud_endpoint.pem
  bind 172.16.1.4:8080 transparent
  option httpchk GET /healthcheck
  timeout client 2m
  timeout server 2m
  server overcloud-controller-0.storage.localdomain 172.16.1.10:8080 check fall 5 inter 2000 rise 2

without

  http-request set-header X-Forwarded-Proto https if { ssl_fc }
  http-request set-header X-Forwarded-Proto http if !{ ssl_fc }
  option httplog

This makes really hard to debug in case of issues.

This patch merges default_listen_options with swift to have config which is
more reliable for debugging

Closes-Bug: #1764731
Change-Id: I6716499b4a10f3ba39db33d6468c261c58ee373d
(cherry picked from commit c5131729e762535e8ec778432e84d82238168388)
(cherry picked from commit 93e7e4ad79b4dfc04f8233a2e36e4f21172b10ce)
"}]
commit_message:
Merge default_listen with swift_proxy_server_listen_options

Currently haproxy for swift doesn't have default setting. This generates config
such as

  listen swift_proxy_server
  bind 10.0.0.5:13808 transparent ssl crt /etc/pki/tls/private/overcloud_endpoint.pem
  bind 172.16.1.4:8080 transparent
  option httpchk GET /healthcheck
  timeout client 2m
  timeout server 2m
  server overcloud-controller-0.storage.localdomain 172.16.1.10:8080 check fall 5 inter 2000 rise 2

without

  http-request set-header X-Forwarded-Proto https if { ssl_fc }
  http-request set-header X-Forwarded-Proto http if !{ ssl_fc }
  option httplog

This makes really hard to debug in case of issues.

This patch merges default_listen_options with swift to have config which is
more reliable for debugging

Closes-Bug: #1764731
Change-Id: I6716499b4a10f3ba39db33d6468c261c58ee373d
(cherry picked from commit c5131729e762535e8ec778432e84d82238168388)
(cherry picked from commit 93e7e4ad79b4dfc04f8233a2e36e4f21172b10ce)

commit_message:
Catch and log errors from process_container, then keep updating

Previously, we'd bomb out hard, and you'd get no more container updates.

Change-Id: I0cea6018269d172bc758eec6348329d1f65de028
Related-Bug: 1400939

commit_message:
Remove support for puppet-ceph

Deployment of a managed Ceph cluster using puppet-ceph
is not supported from the Pike release. From Queens it
is not supported use of puppet-ceph when using an
external Ceph cluster either.

This change removes the old manifests necessary to
support deployment of Ceph via puppet-ceph.

Templates removed by I17b94e8023873f3129a55e69efd751be0674dfcb

Depends-On: I8b22917e7436084028ef4fbe7604d28d6a68bee0
Implements: blueprint remove-puppet-ceph
Change-Id: I052af1f755b40a5fefa1f8d37e62b6b36c931271

Beginning with the Queens release, the keystone install guide
recommends running all interfaces on the same port.So this patch
updates the install guide to reflect that change.

Change-Id: I8b1c290c9dcfb721946b6052da4c14f5bf00378e
(cherry picked from commit 2085162247d3c297e81fa58b185326342b0c53dc)

commit_message:
Update auth_url in install docs

Beginning with the Queens release, the keystone install guide
recommends running all interfaces on the same port.So this patch
updates the install guide to reflect that change.

Change-Id: I8b1c290c9dcfb721946b6052da4c14f5bf00378e
(cherry picked from commit 2085162247d3c297e81fa58b185326342b0c53dc)

commit_message:
Add Service Function Chain support(2)

1. What is the problem
Tricircle does not support update for Service Function Chain
Smoke test failed

2. What is the solution to the problem
Add Service Function Chain update support
There are some problems with networking-sfc and fixed it

3. What the features need to be implemented to the Tricircle
None

Signed-off-by: chenyaguang <chenyaguang@szzt.com.cn>
Co-Authored-By：tangzhuo <ztang@hnu.edu.cn>, yinxiulin <yinxiulin@huawei.com>
Change-Id: I407cb21c298a433bd12b2032b2af28ca7ebb68f0

commit_message:
Improve use of RemoteClient in device tagging test

The device tagging test created a server with an adminPass. This isn't
needed for the SSH RemoteClient - the private key is enough. This patch
removes adminPass and uses the correct pkey kwarg for the private key.

Change-Id: I42532edb2614c2cfac202b8e200a9c6b0d362457

commit_message:
Switch from oslosphinx to openstackdocstheme

- Change to openstackdocstheme which is a theme and extension
support for Sphinx documentation that is published to
docs.openstack.org and developer.openstack.org.
- This patch also updates README.rst

Change-Id: I5922eb9b0f5835be65a5ba3eead78bdf92458452

subject: Fix deployment with public TLS enabled
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-23 10:45:20.000000000', 'message': 'Fix deployment with public TLS enabled

When deploying with tls enabled in public
endpoints, ansible modules fails due SSL certificates
are self-signed.

This change adds a new variable to allow customization
on which endpoints ansible should connect.
Defaults to admin because admin auth parameters defaults
to admin endpoint.

Change-Id: Ic3ed58cf9c9579cae08a11bbfe6fce983b5a9cbc
Closes-Bug: #1720995
(cherry picked from commit 56374206bebe1a4a3f25e2099cbd839f47ff3a6f)
(cherry picked from commit ec8e233f4d4523eee7f777421ac35904151300f2)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix deployment with public TLS enabled

When deploying with tls enabled in public
endpoints, ansible modules fails due SSL certificates
are self-signed.

This change adds a new variable to allow customization
on which endpoints ansible should connect.
Defaults to admin because admin auth parameters defaults
to admin endpoint.

Change-Id: Ic3ed58cf9c9579cae08a11bbfe6fce983b5a9cbc
Closes-Bug: #1720995
(cherry picked from commit 56374206bebe1a4a3f25e2099cbd839f47ff3a6f)
(cherry picked from commit ec8e233f4d4523eee7f777421ac35904151300f2)

commit_message:
Replace port 35357 with 5000

Now that the v2.0 API has been removed, we don't have a reason to
include deployment instructions for two separate applications on
different ports. This change updates the guide to be consistent with
recent changes to the ubuntu packages:

https://git.launchpad.net/~ubuntu-server-dev/ubuntu/+source/keystone/commit/?id=915d787af42096b0fad715e49759cd357e47787e

Change-Id: I555e3559af1f8db9a14e0667969327ea06903c21

commit_message:
Update RHEL/CentOS horizon install instruction

openstack-dashboard.conf in openstack-dashboard package
for RHEL/CentOS does not contain WSGIApplicationGroup configuration
which is required to make the dashboard work correctly.

Change-Id: Ic62fa29015ec153eada9d5e1ba5c06dab3a5eeca
Closes-Bug: #1741354

commit_message:
Adding NVMEoF for libvirt driver

Adding NVMEoF libvirt driver for supporting NVMEoF initiator CLI.
Libvirt NVMe volume driver is added to handle required calls for
attaching and detaching volume from instaces through calling
os-brick's NVMe Connector.

Implements: blueprint nvme-over-fabirc-nova
Co-Authored-By: Ivan Kolodyazhny <e0ne@e0ne.info>
Change-Id: I67a72c4226e54c18b3a6e4a13b5055fa6e85af09

[{'created': '2018-05-29 07:36:41.000000000', 'message': 'Make doc more clearness

Now when running functional and unit tests, if user wants
to use a custom MongoDB instance, he needs to set
two environment variables: "ZAQAR_TEST_MONGODB_URL" and
"ZAQAR_TEST_MONGODB".

Change-Id: I98fe958bfb4fb7f3913de0d0bdc2490f3b441f1b
'}]
commit_message:
Make doc more clearness

Now when running functional and unit tests, if user wants
to use a custom MongoDB instance, he needs to set
two environment variables: "ZAQAR_TEST_MONGODB_URL" and
"ZAQAR_TEST_MONGODB".

Change-Id: I98fe958bfb4fb7f3913de0d0bdc2490f3b441f1b

commit_message:
Remove some rabbit parameters

nova::rabbit_host, nova::rabbit_hosts, nova::rabbit_password,
nova::rabbit_port, nova::rabbit_userid, nova::rabbit_virtual_host and
nova::rpc_backend are deprecated. Please use  nova::default_transport_url
instead.

Change-Id: Icd71df33f6441cfd61c99296c73071c67557e666

commit_message:
Deprecate auth_uri option

Option auth_uri from group keystone_authtoken is deprecated [1].
Use option www_authenticate_uri from group keystone_authtoken.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508522/

Change-Id: Id3097c221ec03ea2b53e0e7f5c654a7e207da0e2

Remove the uselesss pci_alias

The pci_alias parameter is deprecated. Please use
nova::pci::aliases instead.

commit_message:
Modify code for release port when delete vm

1. What is the problem?

In a non-local network, delete a vm from one reigon, and use its port to
create a vm in another region, the port in the original region is not
released.

2. What is the solution to the problem?

Release port to down when delete a vm from one region, and change shadow
port 'name' and 'device_id' and 'device_owner' value if shadow port exist.
In the update port, according to the update before the port and the
updated port to determine whether to notify the Central updates.

3. What the features to be implemented in the Tricircle to realize the solution?

Because port be cached in neutron-openvswitch-agent, not delete port
when delete a vm from one region.

Signed-off-by: zhang xiaohan <zhangxiaohan@szzt.com.cn>
Co-Authored-By: tangzhuo <ztang@hnu.edu.cn>
Change-Id: If6819bf67ea2d206cc735039d8c55733dae54ee9

commit_message:
Add s3api headers to allowed_headers by default

Previously, these headers had to be added by operators to their
object-server.conf when enabling swift3 middleware. Since s3api
is now imported into swift we should go ahead and add these headers
by default too.

Change-Id: Ib82e175096716e42aecdab48f01f079e09da6a1d
Signed-off-by: Thiago da Silva <thiago@redhat.com>

[{'created': '2018-05-28 07:59:44.000000000', 'message': 'Filter out soft-deleted instances from quota_usages

The resources in quota_usages table will minus 1 while
soft deleting an instance. But the soft-deleted instances
are counted when synchronizing quota_usages using command
"nova-manage project quota_usage_refresh". So we filter
out soft-deleted instances when synchronizing quota_usage.

Change-Id: Ic7900cd0333b2388a0fba488f208f02a4aad5716
Closes-bug: #1773542
'}, {'created': '2018-05-28 08:08:55.000000000', 'message': 'Filter out soft-deleted instances from quota_usages

The resources in quota_usages table will minus 1 while
soft deleting an instance. But the soft-deleted instances
are counted when synchronizing quota_usages using command
"nova-manage project quota_usage_refresh". So we filter
out soft-deleted instances when synchronizing quota_usage.

The quota_usage_refresh command has been removed in
17.0.0 (Queens). Since quota usage is counted from resources
instead of being tracked separately.
https://docs.openstack.org/nova/pike/cli/nova-manage.html
But this part of the code still exists in master. So submit
to master first then cherry pick to stable/ocata.

Change-Id: Ic7900cd0333b2388a0fba488f208f02a4aad5716
Closes-bug: #1773542
'}]
commit_message:
Filter out soft-deleted instances from quota_usages

The resources in quota_usages table will minus 1 while
soft deleting an instance. But the soft-deleted instances
are counted when synchronizing quota_usages using command
"nova-manage project quota_usage_refresh". So we filter
out soft-deleted instances when synchronizing quota_usage.

The quota_usage_refresh command has been removed in
17.0.0 (Queens). Since quota usage is counted from resources
instead of being tracked separately.
https://docs.openstack.org/nova/pike/cli/nova-manage.html
But this part of the code still exists in master. So submit
to master first then cherry pick to stable/ocata.

Change-Id: Ic7900cd0333b2388a0fba488f208f02a4aad5716
Closes-bug: #1773542

NeutronSriovHostConfig missing in SRIOV's env files

  host in order to configure SRIOV capable NICs.

Closes-Bug: #1773746

commit_message:
Freeze cmd2 library on python2

The cmd2-0.9.0 is python3-only. Let's freeze the cmd2<0.9.0 as
recommended in https://pypi.org/project/cmd2/ while allowing any newer
version on python 3+.

Change-Id: I568e649ec5fdd0bf875d7ac3ff630e9b6bae6426
Signed-off-by: Lukáš Doktor <ldoktor@redhat.com>

Adjust DHCP range so that nodes can take static address from pool

The pool needs to contain the static addresses for the individual
VM nodes.

subject: fix bootstrap for ubuntu trusty
messages:
[{'account_id': 11365, 'date': '2018-05-30 00:06:40.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2018-05-30 00:06:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2018-05-30 00:59:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Switch to stestr

According to Openstack summit session [1] stestr is
maintained project to which all Openstack projects
should migrate.
Let's switch it then.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/YVR-python-pti

Change-Id: I856024f8b66f5edaf40ae7b798fce21c43d021e7

commit_message:
Migration tool: Enhance ovn_migration.sh script

This patch adds few commands in the ovn_migration.sh script so that the migration
process can be run in steps. It also adds a new ansible playbook file to configure
'dhcp_renewal_time' in dhcp agent configuration file.

With this patch, the user has to run
  Step 1. ./ovn_migration.sh generate-inventory -> This generates the ansible inventory
           file - hosts_for_migration

  Step 2. ./ovn_migration.sh reduce-mtu -> This reduces the MTU of the pre migration
          VxLAN tenant networks and configures 'dhcp_renewal_time' in dhcp agent
          configuration file in the nodes where DHCP agent docker service is running.

  Step 3. ./ovn_migration.sh start-migration -> This kicks start the migration.

This patch also updates the documentation accordingly.

Change-Id: I27ec5d2e42fa8bb1c9e10d9e45a491e0e448cf9f

commit_message:
Add wait_for_interface_detach method

The method waits for an interface to be detached from a server.
It will be used in the subsequent patch that tests tagged device
attach and detach (nova API 2.49).

Change-Id: If23bd5947dea345b30a77bc83c5b3dbfa5a4267b

Before this patch, when unprovisioning a node, the console was left
running. This allowed a user to view the console even after the instance
was gone. Stop the console during unprovisioning to block this.

ConductorManager._set_console_mode will now bubble up any exceptions
raised, so that we can explode as needed during unprovisioning. This
does not have any side effects, as elsewhere it is run in it's own
thread and execution was complete after handling the exception.

Also change a few mock.ANY in the relevant unit tests to the actual task
object, as cleanup.

commit_message:
Tear down console during unprovisioning

Before this patch, when unprovisioning a node, the console was left
running. This allowed a user to view the console even after the instance
was gone. Stop the console during unprovisioning to block this.

ConductorManager._set_console_mode will now bubble up any exceptions
raised, so that we can explode as needed during unprovisioning. This
does not have any side effects, as elsewhere it is run in it's own
thread and execution was complete after handling the exception.

Also change a few mock.ANY in the relevant unit tests to the actual task
object, as cleanup.

Conflicts:
	ironic/tests/unit/conductor/test_manager.py

Change-Id: Iec128444d692e0b0fbc1737eb21b0e6f69b7ec1e
Partial-Bug: #1769817
Story: #2002000
Task: #19634
(cherry picked from commit 7a8b26db6b48f5593786bb92cf09fa1d6afcc1ea)

commit_message:
Tear down console during unprovisioning

Before this patch, when unprovisioning a node, the console was left
running. This allowed a user to view the console even after the instance
was gone. Stop the console during unprovisioning to block this.

ConductorManager._set_console_mode will now bubble up any exceptions
raised, so that we can explode as needed during unprovisioning. This
does not have any side effects, as elsewhere it is run in it's own
thread and execution was complete after handling the exception.

Also change a few mock.ANY in the relevant unit tests to the actual task
object, as cleanup.

Conflicts:
	ironic/tests/unit/conductor/test_manager.py

Change-Id: Iec128444d692e0b0fbc1737eb21b0e6f69b7ec1e
Partial-Bug: #1769817
Story: #2002000
Task: #19634
(cherry picked from commit 7a8b26db6b48f5593786bb92cf09fa1d6afcc1ea)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-25 11:54:25.000000000', 'message': "Improve exception handling in agent_base_vendor

Currently we catch all Exception classes in a few places and log only
the error message. This is very problematic when e.g. KeyError happens,
since its error message is the missing key.

This change:
* Adds exception class to the error message wherever Exception is caught
* Logs traceback when the caught exception does not inherit IronicException
  (we assume that IronicException's come with good error messages and from
  predictable places)
* Fixes meaningless error message when boot.prepare_instance fails.

Story: #2002089
Task: #19761
Change-Id: I2a7ddcfbde36b31af8d9560500ce1dd47db5b642
(cherry picked from commit 1d0f90c9e757fca2b42e5e9749c7e7db9b5a600c)
"}]
commit_message:
Improve exception handling in agent_base_vendor

Currently we catch all Exception classes in a few places and log only
the error message. This is very problematic when e.g. KeyError happens,
since its error message is the missing key.

This change:
* Adds exception class to the error message wherever Exception is caught
* Logs traceback when the caught exception does not inherit IronicException
  (we assume that IronicException's come with good error messages and from
  predictable places)
* Fixes meaningless error message when boot.prepare_instance fails.

Story: #2002089
Task: #19761
Change-Id: I2a7ddcfbde36b31af8d9560500ce1dd47db5b642
(cherry picked from commit 1d0f90c9e757fca2b42e5e9749c7e7db9b5a600c)

commit_message:
Make lower-constraints job voting

The lower-constraints job is based on python3, and was therefore
failing. Now that the py35 job is fixed, we can also make
lower-constraints voting.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/567078
Change-Id: I35da88e9b6977dfbdaeee24a5c2ba18a62d23789

[{'created': '2018-05-09 15:05:31.000000000', 'message': "Lower the default stunnel log level

Right now the default stunnel.conf log level is set at 'notice'
which, when we deploy redis, fills up the logs with the following
messages:
May 09 14:18:36 controller-1.redhat.local dockerd-current[19810]: 2018.05.09 14:18:36 LOG5[1:139972682520320]: connect_blocking: connected 127.0.0.1:6379
May 09 14:18:36 controller-1.redhat.local dockerd-current[19810]: 2018.05.09 14:18:36 LOG5[1:139972682520320]: Service [redis] connected remote server from 127.0.0.1:60412
May 09 14:18:36 controller-1.redhat.local stunnel[41495]: LOG5[1:139972682409728]: Service [redis] accepted connection from 172.17.1.21:60770
May 09 14:18:36 controller-1.redhat.local dockerd-current[19810]: 2018.05.09 14:18:36 LOG5[1:139972682409728]: Service [redis] accepted connection from 172.17.1.21:60770
May 09 14:18:36 controller-1.redhat.local stunnel[41495]: LOG5[1:139972682409728]: connect_blocking: connected 127.0.0.1:6379
May 09 14:18:36 controller-1.redhat.local dockerd-current[19810]: 2018.05.09 14:18:36 LOG5[1:139972682409728]: connect_blocking: connected 127.0.0.1:6379
May 09 14:18:36 controller-1.redhat.local stunnel[41495]: LOG5[1:139972682409728]: Service [redis] connected remote server from 127.0.0.1:60418

Those messages are from the haproxy healthceck. Let's move the
default debug config to warning which will ignore the above errors.

Closes-Bug: #1770180

Change-Id: I93bd0048e85864fa9e62dc38c3575ec7b48e5df5

commit_message:
Lower the default stunnel log level

Right now the default stunnel.conf log level is set at 'notice'
which, when we deploy redis, fills up the logs with the following
messages:
May 09 14:18:36 controller-1.redhat.local dockerd-current[19810]: 2018.05.09 14:18:36 LOG5[1:139972682520320]: connect_blocking: connected 127.0.0.1:6379
May 09 14:18:36 controller-1.redhat.local dockerd-current[19810]: 2018.05.09 14:18:36 LOG5[1:139972682520320]: Service [redis] connected remote server from 127.0.0.1:60412
May 09 14:18:36 controller-1.redhat.local stunnel[41495]: LOG5[1:139972682409728]: Service [redis] accepted connection from 172.17.1.21:60770
May 09 14:18:36 controller-1.redhat.local dockerd-current[19810]: 2018.05.09 14:18:36 LOG5[1:139972682409728]: Service [redis] accepted connection from 172.17.1.21:60770

commit_message:
Clean up Cinder backends in capabilities map

Fix references to the NetApp and Veritas Hyperscale Cinder backend
environment files. Also remove extraneous "configured via puppet"
in the backend descriptions.

Closes-Bug: #1769639
Change-Id: Ic5266abcafed5790296fd910b01aadf3d03900b5
(cherry picked from commit 48c6253835cc2fa6cabbd8f3c923bc59f8d75c2a)

commit_message:
Run yum clean to reduce size of docker image layer

This ensures we do not write the yum cache in the layer, making the
image size smaller.

Change-Id: I974bcac75be9231cf282a73db1a22a6f4ba079fc
(cherry picked from commit 0c2305ad80869ded3b0a293610eb863171a392ac)

commit_message:
Missing import of "_"

Function _() are used in these files but not imported.
Eg. ramdisk.py: L178
    base_image_service.py: L198

Change-Id: I5d424c59077193ae64e73a8fdb7f758fa3dc2714
(cherry picked from commit d6deb1ee4a2590d8a5e2032518adddf090e92f8d)

commit_message:
Fix up property names in case of mixed case hostnames

When deploying a stack that containes mixed-case hostnames
the following error might be triggered:
Debug: try 15/20: /usr/sbin/pcs -f
/var/lib/pacemaker/cib/puppet-cib-backup20180405-8-1sqw3dc property set
--node TEST-STACK34-controller-1 redis-role=true
Debug: Error: Error: unable to set attribute redis-role
Could not map name=TEST-STACK34-controller-1 to a UUID
while the name in the cluster is test-stack34-controller-1

This used to work pre-bundles because we used the facter provided
$::hostname variable which was lower-cased for us. With bundles we
switched to setting cluster properties from the service bootstrap nodes
and so we used the '<service>_short_node_names' hiera key which might
contain mixed-case hostnames.

In order to fix this we just downcase() the short_node_names hiera
string that we loop on so we can get the same behaviour we had on bare
metal.

Tested on an env with mixed-case hostnames:
[root@uppercaseovercloud-controller-0 keystone]# hiera -c /etc/puppet/hiera.yaml rabbitmq_short_node_names
["UPPERCASEOverCloud-controller-0",
 "UPPERCASEOverCloud-controller-1",
 "UPPERCASEOverCloud-controller-2"]

Cluster pcs properties were set correctly:
[root@uppercaseovercloud-controller-0 keystone]# pcs property |grep rabbitmq
 uppercaseovercloud-controller-0: galera-role=true haproxy-role=true rabbitmq-role=true redis-role=true rmq-node-attr-last-known-rabbitmq=rabbit@uppercaseovercloud-controller-0
 uppercaseovercloud-controller-1: galera-role=true haproxy-role=true rabbitmq-role=true redis-role=true rmq-node-attr-last-known-rabbitmq=rabbit@uppercaseovercloud-controller-1
 uppercaseovercloud-controller-2: galera-role=true haproxy-role=true rabbitmq-role=true redis-role=true rmq-node-attr-last-known-rabbitmq=rabbit@uppercaseovercloud-controller-2

Co-Authored-By: Damien Ciabrini <dciabrin@redhat.com>
Depends-On: Ie240b8a4217827dd8ade82479a828817d63143ba
Closes-bug: #1773219
Change-Id: I5bd49c4a1b13b2310f8a1173aa6b86abfa5dab3d

subject: Lowercase any hostname comparisons in bootstrap_* scripts
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-29 06:39:31.000000000', 'message': 'Lowercase any hostname comparisons in bootstrap_* scripts

If you deploy a stack with mixed-case hostnames things will break
because no task that is supposed to run on boostrap nodes will run
due to the following code:
HOSTNAME=$(/bin/hostname -s)
SERVICE_NODEID=$(/bin/hiera -c /etc/puppet/hiera.yaml
"${SERVICE_NAME}_short_bootstrap_node_name")
if [[ "$HOSTNAME" == "$SERVICE_NODEID" ]]; then
...

The hiera key might contain mixed-case letters whereas the hostname
won't and the end result is going to be that no bootstrap tasks
will run on any nodes and, amongst other things, no database tables
will be created, making all services unusable.

Since we use bash explicitely we can leverage the ${var,,} expression
for this.

Change-Id: Ie240b8a4217827dd8ade82479a828817d63143ba
Related-Bug: #1773219
(cherry picked from commit 3345557d7b64b29ccee258de8bcd6cfbfa88291e)
'}]
commit_message:
Lowercase any hostname comparisons in bootstrap_* scripts

If you deploy a stack with mixed-case hostnames things will break
because no task that is supposed to run on boostrap nodes will run
due to the following code:
HOSTNAME=$(/bin/hostname -s)
SERVICE_NODEID=$(/bin/hiera -c /etc/puppet/hiera.yaml
"${SERVICE_NAME}_short_bootstrap_node_name")
if [[ "$HOSTNAME" == "$SERVICE_NODEID" ]]; then
...

The hiera key might contain mixed-case letters whereas the hostname
won't and the end result is going to be that no bootstrap tasks
will run on any nodes and, amongst other things, no database tables
will be created, making all services unusable.

Since we use bash explicitely we can leverage the ${var,,} expression
for this.

Change-Id: Ie240b8a4217827dd8ade82479a828817d63143ba
Related-Bug: #1773219
(cherry picked from commit 3345557d7b64b29ccee258de8bcd6cfbfa88291e)

commit_message:
Enable default polling interval override

By default collectd polling interval is set to 10 seconds for all plugins,
which is bringing down the entire cloud if the default Gnocchi deployment
(Swift on controllers) is used. We have to override the default higher value.

Closes-Bug: #1771083
Change-Id: I210c72028da35068ed8469b2d2deb75797a2b08f
(cherry picked from commit 6c5b96c19202d3830b0a066a65198a7a909e7fe8)

The cidr property for a Neutron subnet should contain
the network cidr, not the network prefixlen.

The example portmap for the fake neutron port in tripleo
depleoyed-server is not correct. We should pass the
netowork cidr in the subnets so that the fake neutron
port subnets attribute return something that match what
an actual neutron port would return.

Related-Bug: #1772396
Change-Id: I45f5cd1924c1d74cf12719dbed160ea960478850
'}]
commit_message:
Deployed Server - portmap should match neutron API

The cidr property for a Neutron subnet should contain
the network cidr, not the network prefixlen.

The example portmap for the fake neutron port in tripleo
depleoyed-server is not correct. We should pass the
netowork cidr in the subnets so that the fake neutron
port subnets attribute return something that match what
an actual neutron port would return.

Related-Bug: #1772396
Change-Id: I45f5cd1924c1d74cf12719dbed160ea960478850

commit_message:
uncap eventlet

We will manage the eventlet version using constraints now. See the
thread starting at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-April/129096.html
for more details.

Change-Id: If1ce7c0454ff0f7e8dc6de186dcdff99870cf8c8
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

messages:

Even, I don't know why the older case passed in my local tho. I may be missing something?"}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2018-05-21 18:32:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

(3 comments)

Seems likely to be the right idea? I'd like to fix up make_*request to not do this quote/unquote dance, but

- this is better targeted for a bugfix, and
- the upgrade may be difficult for third-party middlewares.

Will move to +2 once I actually play around with it and verify I can't break it :-)"}, {'account_id': 4608, 'date': '2018-05-22 19:07:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 4608, 'date': '2018-05-22 19:08:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2018-05-24 18:49:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2

Fun way to test this:

 diff --git a/test/functional/tests.py b/test/functional/tests.py
 index 6ed11ed39..6ce7d4230 100644
 --- a/test/functional/tests.py
 +++ b/test/functional/tests.py
 @@ -49,7 +49,7 @@ def tearDownModule():
  class Utils(object):
      @classmethod
      def create_ascii_name(cls, length=None):
 -        return uuid.uuid4().hex
 +        return uuid.uuid4().hex + '%ff'
  
      @classmethod
      def create_utf8_name(cls, length=None):

...which still turns up 85 failures! Looks like there are still issues lurking in dlo, slo, staticweb, symlink, and tempurl :-(

There was one unexpected failure related to versioned_writes:

    Traceback (most recent call last):
      File "test/functional/test_versioned_writes.py", line 529, in test_versioning_container_acl
        cfg={'use_token': self.env.storage_token2}))
      File "test/functional/swift_test_client.py", line 1018, in write
        self.conn.make_path(self.path))
    test.functional.swift_test_client.ResponseError: 412: 'Precondition Failed' ('PUT' '/v1/AUTH_test/9e68fa12dacb4a0fa68fbc2227c91aa5%25ff/cbb08f3948654442a5d94bd622ca88ef%25ff') txid=txde7781ea116a4a7784397-005b070536

I'll work on getting more details on that, but this is already loads better than the 95 failures I was getting without these versioned_writes changes.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2018-05-24 20:09:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)

All right, figured it out -- that was the only test that used the result of create_name() in its entirety for the archive container! Which means that *really*, you want to test with something like

 diff --git a/test/functional/test_versioned_writes.py b/test/functional/test_versioned_writes.py
 index 5de994e55..4744a32a0 100644
 --- a/test/functional/test_versioned_writes.py
 +++ b/test/functional/test_versioned_writes.py
 @@ -57,7 +57,7 @@ class TestObjectVersioningEnv(BaseEnv):
          # character
          prefix = Utils.create_name().decode("utf-8")[:10].encode("utf-8")
  
 -        cls.versions_container = cls.account.container(prefix + "-versions")
 +        cls.versions_container = cls.account.container(prefix + "-versions%ff")
          if not cls.versions_container.create():
              raise ResponseError(cls.conn.response)
  
 diff --git a/test/functional/tests.py b/test/functional/tests.py
 index 6ed11ed39..6ce7d4230 100644
 --- a/test/functional/tests.py
 +++ b/test/functional/tests.py
 @@ -49,7 +49,7 @@ def tearDownModule():
  class Utils(object):
      @classmethod
      def create_ascii_name(cls, length=None):
 -        return uuid.uuid4().hex
 +        return uuid.uuid4().hex + '%ff'

[{'created': '2018-03-22 10:40:52.000000000', 'message': "Fix versioned writes error with url-encoded object name

With url encoded object name like '%25ff' that can be url-encoded
value after decoded can cause 412 Precondition Failed. And more,
that can do nothing (no versioned object creation) even it returns
a successful response.

The root causes are in versioned_writes middleware as follows:

A. unnecessary unquote in object_request method
B. incorrect use of make_pre_authed_request that takes 'quoted'
   path in the args. That is described at [1] explicitely.

This patch resolved those 2 bugs at once, and then, now we can create
%25ff versioned object reported in the launchpad with this patch.

Perhaps, more tests would be nice to have. This patch added a few
test cases on that.

1: https://github.com/openstack/swift/blob/master/swift/common/wsgi.py#L1174

Note that make_subrequest and its caller should have *quoted* path but
make_env should *NOT*. That might make us confused.

Closes-Bug: #1755554

commit_message:
Fix versioned writes error with url-encoded object name

With url encoded object name like '%25ff' that can be url-encoded
value after decoded can cause 412 Precondition Failed. And more,
that can do nothing (no versioned object creation) even it returns
a successful response.

The root causes are in versioned_writes middleware as follows:

A. unnecessary unquote in object_request method
B. incorrect use of make_pre_authed_request that takes 'quoted'
   path in the args. That is described at [1] explicitely.

This patch resolved those 2 bugs at once, and then, now we can create
%25ff versioned object reported in the launchpad with this patch.

Perhaps, more tests would be nice to have. This patch added a few
test cases on that.

1: https://github.com/openstack/swift/blob/master/swift/common/wsgi.py#L1174

Note that make_subrequest and its caller should have *quoted* path but
make_env should *NOT*. That might make us confused.

Closes-Bug: #1755554

Change-Id: Ibcd90cc633c68973929ee5249c6598c22b342e3e

commit_message:
expose objects as entry points in setup.cfg

We've already added support for pluggable (via entry points) object
loading in neutron-lib with [1]

This patch exposes the neutron.objects in setup.cfg using entry points
so that consumers can start to use them via the API in [1] rather than
directly import them from neutron.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/553838/

Change-Id: I25ddd77c55f48997ff6131f232addb4c2e629804

it *looks* like the LockTimeout __str__ will include the path to the db_file in the log message - but it'd be nice to have a unittest to to show it...

There's a couple of test's in test.unit.container.test_updater that use mock.patch.object - I think you could trick a mock with a side_effect of a LockTimeout to hit that code path... probably be good enough.

It looks like those tests use the old FakeLogger instead of the debug_logger helper, so if you write a new test you may want to use that instead.

If you need any help with the test jump in #openstack-swift on freenode and someone can probably whip up the start of a diff for you.  Good Luck!"}, {'account_id': 11373, 'date': '2015-12-25 06:00:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 11373, 'date': '2015-12-25 06:10:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

commit_message:
catch lock fail exception in container updater

in process of container update, when locking one container failed,
container updater stops with LockTimeout exception.

it's better for updater server to continue processing
other containers, partitions instead of stop updating.

this path is to catch timeout exception and log it,
then continue processing other containers and partitions.

Closes-bug: #1400939

Change-Id: I42adec07d980be22044a5d4ef6771318a3eed168

PyPi now validates that the description used for a package is in valid
RST format. This adds a note to the pep8 style check information for

'}]
commit_message:
Add note about checking README in pep8 tests

PyPi now validates that the description used for a package is in valid
RST format. This adds a note to the pep8 style check information for
Python project setup suggesting that checks are run in the pep8 target
to make sure RST validation passes.

Change-Id: Idb2ed741ec8c9b683547e1e7884e2306739ad096

messages: [{'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2018-05-29 17:51:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2018-05-29 18:07:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 330, 'date': '2018-05-29 18:49:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1\n\nyeah, let's do it this way for the 2.18.0 release."}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-29 17:51:47.000000000', 'message': 'Change default sharding threshold to 1,000,000 objects

...instead of 10,000,000. The sample configs were already using one
million, all of our testing with non-SAIO containers was done with
one million, and the resulting container DBs were around 100MB which
seems like a comfortable size. Pretty sure this was just a typo during
some code cleanup.

Change-Id: Icd31f9d8efaac2d5dc0f021cad550687859558b9
'}]
commit_message:
Change default sharding threshold to 1,000,000 objects

...instead of 10,000,000. The sample configs were already using one
million, all of our testing with non-SAIO containers was done with
one million, and the resulting container DBs were around 100MB which
seems like a comfortable size. Pretty sure this was just a typo during
some code cleanup.

Change-Id: Icd31f9d8efaac2d5dc0f021cad550687859558b9

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-25 06:01:41.000000000', 'message': "Test our master with neutron's master

Pulling neutron from pypi has been working because we happen to
work with neutron 12.x (queens), but we should really be testing
our master branch with neutron's master branch, not with queens.

This effectively reverts 3b55348dfb2b306af95714a3be90dd8ad4ae4a18.

It also uses git.openstack.org instead of github.com in links.

Change-Id: I18050cfdf9401009f0a87d6cc8b968b7fe3a3bf0
"}, {'created': '2018-05-29 17:58:49.000000000', 'message': "Test our master with neutron's master

Pulling neutron from pypi has been working because we happen to
work with neutron 12.x (queens), but we should really be testing
our master branch with neutron's master branch, not with queens.

This effectively reverts 3b55348dfb2b306af95714a3be90dd8ad4ae4a18.

commit_message:
Test our master with neutron's master

Pulling neutron from pypi has been working because we happen to
work with neutron 12.x (queens), but we should really be testing
our master branch with neutron's master branch, not with queens.

This effectively reverts 3b55348dfb2b306af95714a3be90dd8ad4ae4a18.

Some lower constraints needed to be updated to match neutron's
master branch.

It also uses git.openstack.org instead of github.com in links.

Change-Id: I18050cfdf9401009f0a87d6cc8b968b7fe3a3bf0

commit_message:
Fix pep8 before moving to master

In anticipation of repointing our tox to use neutron master (rather than
staying one release behind via requirements, as we have been), we needed
to fix some pep8 errors that got un-ignored.

Change-Id: I1c25ebe62108e300c16c0a503f1dcc919259bf7d

commit_message:
Power fault recovery: apply fault

This patch implements setting and using the fault field.

For each case currently maintenance is set to True, the fault is set
accordingly. A periodic task is added to check power state for nodes
in maintenance due to power failure, maintenance is cleared if the
power state of a node can be retrieved.

When a node is taken out of maintenance by user, the fault is
cleared (if there is any).

Story: #1596107
Task: #10469

Change-Id: Ic4ab20af9022a2d06bdac567e7a098f3ba08570a
Partial-Bug: #1596107

[{'created': '2017-01-10 20:29:05.000000000', 'message': 'Use support report command to collect node logs

This change updates the CI to leverage the "openstack overcloud support
report" command to collect logs from all of the overcloud nodes as part
of the multinode job. This adds coverage of this feature into the CI.

Change-Id: I1cd4e2d5de137813d4e09311c812468efb159cc7

commit_message:
Use support report command to collect node logs

This change updates the CI to leverage the "openstack overcloud support
report collect" command to collect logs from all of the overcloud nodes as part
of the multinode job. This adds coverage of this feature into the CI.

Depends-On: I45699dfa6eb3e83d419c7041dbb72cc5d5e4f0ea
Change-Id: I1cd4e2d5de137813d4e09311c812468efb159cc7
Related-Blueprint: capture-environment-status-and-logs

Use /usr/share/openstack-dashboard/openstack_dashboard/local/
instead of site-packages/** for ubuntu/binary installs.

Signed-off-by: Jorge Niedbalski <jorge.niedbalski@linaro.org>

subject: Switch to iterable version of server listing (and expose iterable method)
messages:
[{'account_id': 1297, 'date': '2018-05-18 19:24:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 1297, 'date': '2018-05-18 19:25:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 1297, 'date': '2018-05-18 21:17:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2018-05-19 12:51:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

I **love** this - thank you. It's actually a pattern we need to deal with looking forward towards using the sdk behind shade (which uses iterators for listing by default (can't use that yet, there's too much plumbing we need to fix first)

How about calling the method 'iter_servers' - the overall pattern is 'verb_noun' - and I kinda feel like this is potentially a thing we might want to do to all of our resources."}, {'account_id': 1297, 'date': '2018-05-21 19:25:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Will adjust, just fyi the whole locking and caching becomes really an issue with iteration (so ya, IMHO we might want to redo that whole stuff).'}, {'account_id': 1297, 'date': '2018-05-21 20:27:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2018-05-27 13:33:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Yes - we DEFINITELY want to redo the caching and locking layer. I want to copy the multi-threaded task manager in from nodepool first - there is a usecase that's important to nodepool's task manager that one can't see in the codebase, making it harder to talk to people about a refactor.

Which is to say - ZOMG YES - it's a really important task, let's connect on it soon."}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2018-05-27 13:34:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 1297, 'date': '2018-05-29 19:55:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Hmmmm, interesting, multithreaded task manager == https://docs.python.org/3/library/concurrent.futures.html ?'}]

commit_message:
Switch to iterable version of server listing (and expose iterable method)

This adds a new server listing mechanism that will yield back each server
block that is returned; it is useful for large clouds with projects with
a large number of active or deleted instances.

For example, in the current list servers it builds up a few lists which can grow
quite big (and consume a lot of memory) making it hard to list projects servers
that have existed for a long time, but with an iterable verion those lists do
not grow (since they just consume the current chunk).

Also the iterable version is more easily used in programs with progress bars
or anything like that that can take advantage of the knowledge that the listing
is at a given chunk (of many).

Change-Id: I84c15e664fb2f72f563618483f9df1c99d215faf

commit_message:
k8s_fedora: Make CoreDNS config a SoftwareDeployment

After adding the autoscaler for coredns, the limit
for user_data was reached again. Make coredns
config a SoftwareDeployment.

Change-Id: I0a9852e9293842e859947acf0c4b6da20394436a
Closes-Bug: #1757554

[{'created': '2018-05-21 18:18:13.000000000', 'message': 'NetApp ONTAP iSCSI: Force exception on online extend

The Netapp ONTAP iSCSI driver does not support online volume extend. It
may work if the requested size does not exceed the LUN max geometry,
otherwise it will require the LUN to be detached. In such case, the
backend currently detaches and leaves the volume in an inconsistent
state.

This patch forces the ONTAP iSCSI driver to raise an exception whenever
an online extend is requested and it detects it would exceed the LUN max
geometry.

Change-Id: Ie3dddbc05c6cd32e27168d68f4cb819364b0438c
Closes-Bug: #1712651
(cherry picked from commit 2b60912d5667350eae7ecbc67d4dba3658518d10)
'}]
commit_message:
NetApp ONTAP iSCSI: Force exception on online extend

The Netapp ONTAP iSCSI driver does not support online volume extend. It
may work if the requested size does not exceed the LUN max geometry,
otherwise it will require the LUN to be detached. In such case, the
backend currently detaches and leaves the volume in an inconsistent
state.

This patch forces the ONTAP iSCSI driver to raise an exception whenever
an online extend is requested and it detects it would exceed the LUN max
geometry.

Change-Id: Ie3dddbc05c6cd32e27168d68f4cb819364b0438c
Closes-Bug: #1712651
(cherry picked from commit 2b60912d5667350eae7ecbc67d4dba3658518d10)

commit_message:
Add QoS command for ovn northbound db.

add commands: 'qos_add/qos_del/qos_list'.
This may be used for Floating IP QoS.

Change-Id: Ib0f74ab86fd3382452c9ff834e94a643e9fac9bc

subject: common-tasks: Do not sync preconfigured /etc/pip.conf file
messages: [{'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-05-15 11:49:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 23163, 'date': '2018-05-15 13:32:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-05-29 18:30:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-15 11:49:55.000000000', 'message': "common-tasks: Do not sync preconfigured /etc/pip.conf file

Zuul places a /etc/pip.conf file on the host as shown below

2018-05-02 11:48:59.945452 | TASK [configure-mirrors : Install /etc/pip.conf configuration]

However, we don't need that since we have our own role to configure pip
which overrides the Zuul one anyway. For the hosts which are not
configured with the pip_install role, this can actually cause problems
so we wipe the file and we let our own role configure it the way we want
to.

Change-Id: I45a900b056db1c8a173f9ed1dae1bd998915e9d4
(cherry picked from commit c2030ef9741c095d6babe07b00ce6a30bed4245f)
"}]
commit_message:
common-tasks: Do not sync preconfigured /etc/pip.conf file

Zuul places a /etc/pip.conf file on the host as shown below

2018-05-02 11:48:59.945452 | TASK [configure-mirrors : Install /etc/pip.conf configuration]

However, we don't need that since we have our own role to configure pip
which overrides the Zuul one anyway. For the hosts which are not
configured with the pip_install role, this can actually cause problems
so we wipe the file and we let our own role configure it the way we want
to.

Change-Id: I45a900b056db1c8a173f9ed1dae1bd998915e9d4
(cherry picked from commit c2030ef9741c095d6babe07b00ce6a30bed4245f)

subject: Transaction: Handle NOT_LOCKED status
messages: [{'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2018-05-16 12:54:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 20229, 'date': '2018-05-29 13:22:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 5756, 'date': '2018-05-29 19:02:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-16 12:54:30.000000000', 'message': "Transaction: Handle NOT_LOCKED status

This patch is changing the commit_block() from the Transaction class to
handle the NOT_LOCKED status and treat it as an error.

The reason to treat it as an error is because, when the connection with
the OVSDB is reestabilished we don't know if that transaction will
belong to a worker that is holding a valid lock or not, so we won't
attempt to retry it.

The patch is also adding a log for unknown status, in case another
status that is not handled by ovsdbapp is returned the log will give us
some hints about what's going on instead of failing siently.

Related-Bug: #1754291
Change-Id: I5dcb226c387092cba1adb9dbf1ec782e0bac66ba
(cherry picked from commit b7c9dc9f0a86ddce99c8b189614bc4e39e0c59ff)
"}]
commit_message:
Transaction: Handle NOT_LOCKED status

This patch is changing the commit_block() from the Transaction class to
handle the NOT_LOCKED status and treat it as an error.

The reason to treat it as an error is because, when the connection with
the OVSDB is reestabilished we don't know if that transaction will
belong to a worker that is holding a valid lock or not, so we won't
attempt to retry it.

The patch is also adding a log for unknown status, in case another
status that is not handled by ovsdbapp is returned the log will give us
some hints about what's going on instead of failing siently.

Related-Bug: #1754291
Change-Id: I5dcb226c387092cba1adb9dbf1ec782e0bac66ba
(cherry picked from commit b7c9dc9f0a86ddce99c8b189614bc4e39e0c59ff)

commit_message:
Update repo_build test-vars data

This updates the repo_build data to the current
package list output from the py_pkgs lookup.

It also changes the implementation of how the
test data is stored and consumed to make it easier
to maintain in the future.

Some line spacing is also added to the test playbook
to make the tasks easier to distinguish.

Conflicts:
1. tests/test-vars.yml
   due to the old test data removed being different
2. tests/test-data.yml
   due to the test data for stable/queens being different

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/568621
Change-Id: Icf102a78fd0cf9aae3c09378235f2d91f7db8cdd
(cherry picked from commit 98fcbb28ebd6e6f0cd21b2c43f556ffe74a00e23)

commit_message:
Update repo_build test-vars data

This updates the repo_build data to the current
package list output from the py_pkgs lookup.

It also changes the implementation of how the
test data is stored and consumed to make it easier
to maintain in the future.

Some line spacing is also added to the test playbook
to make the tasks easier to distinguish.

Conflicts:
1. tests/test-vars.yml
   due to the old test data removed being different
2. tests/test-data.yml
   due to the test data for stable/queens being different

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/568621
Change-Id: Icf102a78fd0cf9aae3c09378235f2d91f7db8cdd
(cherry picked from commit 98fcbb28ebd6e6f0cd21b2c43f556ffe74a00e23)

When an instance is updated/created in the DF local controller, the
DF local controller now iterates all references within the instance,
and sends an update/create event for all instances referenced by that
instance.

For instance, logical port P references security group S. Suppose the
local controller did not receive the event that S was created (yet).
Once the event on P is received, that event cannot be processed until
the event that S is created is received. This change adds that queuing
behaviour.

Related-Bug: #1690775
Related-Bug: #1708178
Change-Id: Ic2ee535c0898b37c200719381f61c954b9ff7ddf

commit_message:
A model instance update also sends an update on all referred instances

When an instance is updated/created in the DF local controller, the
DF local controller now iterates all references within the instance,
and sends an update/create event for all instances referenced by that
instance.

For instance, logical port P references security group S. Suppose the
local controller did not receive the event that S was created (yet).
Once the event on P is received, that event cannot be processed until
the event that S is created is received. This change adds that queuing
behaviour.

Related-Bug: #1690775
Related-Bug: #1708178
Change-Id: Ic2ee535c0898b37c200719381f61c954b9ff7ddf

commit_message:
use master for lower constraints job

The openstack-tox-lower-constraints zuul job should be testing
master networking-powervm against master neutron, not the latest
neutron version on pypi. We will use a zuul job variant to do that.

We also add a comment in requirements.txt noting that the neutron
version listed there may not actually be sufficient. Our master
branch should really require neutron's master branch, but of course
that won't be on pypi until it is released. When tagging releases,
we should wait for neutron to release first, update our
requirements.txt to point to the new neutron version (finally making
it correct) and then tag our own release.

Change-Id: Id7447060f98469ed63410aa0e56767bcc34b3b08

messages: [{'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2018-05-27 09:30:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2018-05-29 14:03:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-27 09:30:25.000000000', 'message': "Fix duplicate entries in /etc/sysconfig/iptables

Commit 94ca328e5d309a5617043b2944e65df79271e0cd
introduced filters for ephemeral firewall rules
managed by Ironic Inspectors iptables PXE filter.
These new filters cause duplicate entries in the
persisted firewall rules.

sed expression '/-m comment --comment/p' was used
to ensure the ironic-inspector api port is not
accidentally removed. But the expression also
matches several other entries causing duplicates
to be written.

This change enhances the expression to check for
'-m comment --comment' and 'ironic-inspector'.

Closes-Bug: #1771128
Change-Id: I0a75a7aff9b1a0afbad63e4b6b5159f4351c7ee8
(cherry picked from commit cafb998f9ed0375fc856913d0223da86197d09be)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix duplicate entries in /etc/sysconfig/iptables

Commit 94ca328e5d309a5617043b2944e65df79271e0cd
introduced filters for ephemeral firewall rules
managed by Ironic Inspectors iptables PXE filter.
These new filters cause duplicate entries in the
persisted firewall rules.

sed expression '/-m comment --comment/p' was used
to ensure the ironic-inspector api port is not
accidentally removed. But the expression also
matches several other entries causing duplicates
to be written.

This change enhances the expression to check for
'-m comment --comment' and 'ironic-inspector'.

Closes-Bug: #1771128
Change-Id: I0a75a7aff9b1a0afbad63e4b6b5159f4351c7ee8
(cherry picked from commit cafb998f9ed0375fc856913d0223da86197d09be)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-14 23:18:32.000000000', 'message': "Default Octavia SSH pub key to UC default keypair

The Octavia public key configuration is run by Mistral meaning under the
'mistral' user. The previously default /home/stack/.ssh/id_rsa.pub file
may not be readable or not accessible because the of lack of permissions
from its parent directory leading to permission denied and hence failure
to deploy overcloud. It is safer to not default to a file path but to
use the existing 'default' keypair from the undercloud which anyway is
the public key of the 'stack' user. Users can still specify a file path
but will need to ensure it is readable.

Related-Bug: #1770641
Change-Id: I1dea4a8d5bb3c5a64ee7fb8995b837909bc1cafe
(cherry picked from commit 0e87e640c88c316a8bc8d75974c8ac79aca868be)
"}]
commit_message:
Default Octavia SSH pub key to UC default keypair

The Octavia public key configuration is run by Mistral meaning under the
'mistral' user. The previously default /home/stack/.ssh/id_rsa.pub file
may not be readable or not accessible because the of lack of permissions
from its parent directory leading to permission denied and hence failure
to deploy overcloud. It is safer to not default to a file path but to
use the existing 'default' keypair from the undercloud which anyway is
the public key of the 'stack' user. Users can still specify a file path
but will need to ensure it is readable.

Related-Bug: #1770641
Change-Id: I1dea4a8d5bb3c5a64ee7fb8995b837909bc1cafe
(cherry picked from commit 0e87e640c88c316a8bc8d75974c8ac79aca868be)

commit_message:
NFV: Support for config-download to deploy node with kernel args

For NFV deployments, specific kernel args should be applied and
the nodes should be restarted before running the NetworkDeployment.
It is supported in the heat deployment via PreNetworkConfig. In the
config-download mechanism, ansible steps need to be improved
to handle the reboot and wait for the node.

Change-Id: I43b383ad0e04b8be6c321f8c5b05e628b2520141

commit_message:
Pin cmd2 to the last python2 version of the library

The cmd2-0.9.0 is python3-only and the rally venv is built
unconstrained, so it's trying to bring in the latest version
which is incompatible with python2. We pin the library to
ensure that the venv build completes correctly.

We also re-arrange the package list to be alphabetically
sorted.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/570909
Change-Id: I1e259ce98fc8517c0cd00a04d6fe7b3f0703f5b4
(cherry picked from commit 5b964963998dbac029bd7c0b1a6e87eb4a2c28ac)

commit_message:
Pin cmd2 to the last python2 version of the library

The cmd2-0.9.0 is python3-only and the rally venv is built
unconstrained, so it's trying to bring in the latest version
which is incompatible with python2. We pin the library to
ensure that the venv build completes correctly.

We also re-arrange the package list to be alphabetically
sorted.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/570907
Change-Id: I1e259ce98fc8517c0cd00a04d6fe7b3f0703f5b4
(cherry picked from commit 5b964963998dbac029bd7c0b1a6e87eb4a2c28ac)

[{'created': '2018-05-22 22:39:13.000000000', 'message': "Load data eagerly by subselect

Only lazy loading makes operations slower.

Lazy loading here doesn't result in only loading when objects are needed
because in from_sqlalchemy_model the object relations are walked, which
triggers the loading, even when later the object won't be used.

This adds the eager loading again that was removed in
7e35b183f925ad744cfcff5f405df131ad1d5f66 but replaces join with
subselect and marks additional relations for eager loading.

The additional ones are LoadBalancer->Port[vip_port];
PoolV2[pools]<-LoadBalancer; L7Policy[l7_policies]<-PoolV2;
Listener[listeners]<-PoolV2; Listener[listeners]<-LoadBalancer.

Except LoadBalancer->Port[vip_port], these relationships were already
marked for eager loading in the other direction in that patch.

Because of from_sqlalchemy_model before that patch most object loads
were a combination of eager any lazy loading.

commit_message:
Load data eagerly by subselect

Only lazy loading makes operations slower.

Lazy loading here doesn't result in only loading when objects are needed
because in from_sqlalchemy_model the object relations are walked, which
triggers the loading, even when later the object won't be used.

This adds the eager loading again that was removed in
7e35b183f925ad744cfcff5f405df131ad1d5f66 but replaces join with
subselect and marks additional relations for eager loading.

The additional ones are LoadBalancer->Port[vip_port];
PoolV2[pools]<-LoadBalancer; L7Policy[l7_policies]<-PoolV2;
Listener[listeners]<-PoolV2; Listener[listeners]<-LoadBalancer.

Except LoadBalancer->Port[vip_port], these relationships were already
marked for eager loading in the other direction in that patch.

Because of from_sqlalchemy_model before that patch most object loads
were a combination of eager any lazy loading.

Change-Id: Id428a2d8a941183b7073a77be856f37f5a26c0c0

'}, {'created': '2018-05-15 09:37:50.000000000', 'message': "Raise KeyboardInterrupt on SIGTERM - Workaround

Catch SIGTERM signal and call the signal handler method.
The signal handler then raises KeyboardInterrupt. The
KeyboardInterrupt won't be caught by any 'except Exception'
clauses.

Without this the service does not stop periodic workers,
tear down pxe filters etc as it is supposed to on shutdown.

NOTE: Calling shutdown() directly from the signal handler
causes the below error. This is why the signal handler
raises KeyboardInterrupt.
 AssertionError: Cannot switch to MAINLOOP from MAINLOOP

This patch differs from the commit on master:
 * It also imports 'signal' module. In master the signal
   module was already imported.
 * Adds system.exit() to the shutdown() method.
 * Updates unit tests to mock sys.exit()

Related-Bug: #1765700

commit_message:
Raise KeyboardInterrupt on SIGTERM - Workaround

Catch SIGTERM signal and call the signal handler method.
The signal handler then raises KeyboardInterrupt. The
KeyboardInterrupt won't be caught by any 'except Exception'
clauses.

Without this the service does not stop periodic workers,
tear down pxe filters etc as it is supposed to on shutdown.

NOTE: Calling shutdown() directly from the signal handler
causes the below error. This is why the signal handler
raises KeyboardInterrupt.
 AssertionError: Cannot switch to MAINLOOP from MAINLOOP

This patch differs from the commit on master:
 * It also imports 'signal' module. In master the signal
   module was already imported.

Related-Bug: #1765700

Story: 2001890
Task: 14374
Change-Id: If0e24eae767b7806243fa4ae34fedb30ae9af25a
(cherry picked from commit 737dbeae118cc136597565c8c1449fca4945143c)

commit_message:
Fix shelving a paused instance

It is possible to shelve a paused instance, but in that case the
guest is already shutdown, and some hypervisors will fail when
trying to perform a clean shutdown of a non-running guest. For
example, attempting to shelve a paused libvirt instance will
result in this error:

  libvirtError: Requested operation is not valid: domain is not running

Therefore, if the instance is paused, we don't attempt a clean
shutdown while shelving.

Related Tempest test: https://review.openstack.org/564127/

Closes-Bug: #1745529
Change-Id: I8ca25d9847d50001fbe8513a6c1dba8b697c24e4
(cherry picked from commit d5901f613cf98f61b5253a1568b22af1d9dd1a08)
