revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-28 08:36:07.000000000', 'message': 'flake8: Add W503 to ignore list as invalid

W503 according to the [1] pycodestyle docs is not supposed to be
enabled. But it is.

W503 is something we will likely never enable as it is a personal
style decision and can change depending on the code. There is no one
right answer. Interestingly there is also a W504 which is the opposite
check.

[1] http://pycodestyle.pycqa.org/en/latest/intro.html#error-codes

Change-Id: I1025f21a57837e97280f82baba50fdd823a190cc
(cherry picked from commit c09634ad80988e960af2bcaca737be3e87ba7592)
'}]
commit_message:
flake8: Add W503 to ignore list as invalid

W503 according to the [1] pycodestyle docs is not supposed to be
enabled. But it is.

W503 is something we will likely never enable as it is a personal
style decision and can change depending on the code. There is no one
right answer. Interestingly there is also a W504 which is the opposite
check.

[1] http://pycodestyle.pycqa.org/en/latest/intro.html#error-codes

Change-Id: I1025f21a57837e97280f82baba50fdd823a190cc
(cherry picked from commit c09634ad80988e960af2bcaca737be3e87ba7592)

commit_message:
Add IronicInspector to the Controller roles

By default its stubbed out with OS::Heat::None, so the
default Controler wont include it.

Change-Id: I3bb104538a836a8f2e20e04dea58edfa0e568c2d

+2 when you get tests and depends-on a tempest test.'}, {'account_id': 21041, 'date': '2018-04-22 09:43:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8: Code-Review-1

(3 comments)

Hi Luis,

1. The overall code looks fine.
2. Added few minor comments inside and +1 to Toni's comments.
3. Maybe I'm missing something here, 

   
The way I see/understand it, that currently, Kuryr handles pod's default network, and with this patch, we will support separate default network for each namespace's pods.

A. Why do we need the 'kury-net' CRD here, can't we adopt/use the community 'Network' CRD for that purpose? 

B. In case we would like (in future) to connect pod to a specific network/networks, will we use 'kury'net' for that purpose?

C. In case we would like to support new network attributes (e.g: fast data path), will we extend 'kuryr-net'?"}, {'account_id': 23567, 'date': '2018-04-23 09:48:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

(3 comments)

> 
 > The way I see/understand it, that currently, Kuryr handles pod's
 > default network, and with this patch, we will support separate
 > default network for each namespace's pods.

Yes, but still managed through kuryr, the different is that kuryr will handle the default network for each namespace, instead of for all the pods.

 > 
 > A. Why do we need the 'kury-net' CRD here, can't we adopt/use the
 > community 'Network' CRD for that purpose?

Probably yes, but I understood that effort as more focused on the extra networks for the pods, not for the default one. Also, it seems to be a bit more into the future than something we can do just now. Besides, this is a new subnet driver that you can either enable or not, based on your deployment, which means it will not affect any follow up work on the Network CRD work.
 > 
 > B. In case we would like (in future) to connect pod to a specific
 > network/networks, will we use 'kury'net' for that purpose?

In my view, that will be handled by a different network driver, using the community network crd, right? Though I already played a bit with a toy network driver to enable the user to choose the network of a pod (without CRDs): https://review.openstack.org/#/c/476070/. So, there may be different ways of providing this, and CRDs can be used for sure.
 > 
 > C. In case we would like to support new network attributes (e.g:
 > fast data path), will we extend 'kuryr-net'?

This will go into the extra networks attached to the container, right? At least that is how the current patch sets for adding SRIOV look like, right? A main interface plus the SRIOV one, right?"}, {'account_id': 23567, 'date': '2018-04-23 10:07:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 14352, 'date': '2018-04-23 10:12:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 23567, 'date': '2018-04-23 10:13:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 14352, 'date': '2018-04-23 10:14:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 14352, 'date': '2018-04-23 10:24:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 23567, 'date': '2018-04-23 12:24:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 6598, 'date': '2018-04-24 08:36:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Code-Review-1

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 23567, 'date': '2018-04-24 09:58:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 11600, 'date': '2018-04-24 14:47:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Code-Review-1

commit_message:
Add namespace subnet driver for namespace creation

This patch adds a new subnet driver that creates a new network
for each created k8s namespace. It makes use of K8s CRDs to store
the information about the network resources created for each
namespace

Partially Implements: blueprint network-namespace

Change-Id: I7988e1da7a9ed57f29c85ddcd99bb2c87808010e

commit_message:
Replace port 35357 with 5000 for "auth_url"

Based on the change in Keystone Install Guide [1],
this patch replace port 35357 with 5000 for "auth_url".

For more details, please check similar changes which have been done
on other projects: Nova [2], Neutron [3], Cinder [4], Glance [5].

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/541857
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/562812
[3] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/566491
[4] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/565464
[5] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/558932

Change-Id: Id1253df00293fe3b2827cc115bce25c91d924d67

commit_message:
Bump OpenStack service version

* Bump ceilometer from 9.0.4 to 9.0.5
* Bump heat from 9.0.3 to 9.0.4
* Bump horizon from 12.0.2 to 12.0.3
* Bump ironic from 9.1.3 to 9.1.4
* Bump ironic-inspector from 6.0.1 to 6.0.2
* Bump ironic-ui from 3.0.2 to 3.0.3
* Bump mistral from 5.2.2 to 5.2.3
* Bump neutron from 11.0.2 to 11.0.4
* Bump neutron-dynamic-routing from 11.0.0 to 11.0.1
* Bump neutron-lbaas from 11.0.2 to 11.0.3
* Bump neutron-lbaas-dashboard from 3.0.1 to 3.0.2
* Bump nova from 16.1.0 to 16.1.2
* Bump octavia from 1.0.1 to 1.0.2

Change-Id: I7488b70ff6f2d845cf63ff1d2b63515edc82472e

commit_message:
Remove deprecated rabbit params

Remove the deprecated rabbit params which has been deprecated for
two years. The default_transport_url has been present for a while
now and should be used.

Change-Id: Iba521efa97f9cfd3510c77f93cd627551e442c53

commit_message:
Ensure endpoint has pods before add/remove members

This patch ensure that endpoint has pods before trying to add or
remove them from the lbaas. This is needed as 'should_ignore' is
not checked when on_delete is called upon svc deletion notification

Closes-Bug: 1773349

Change-Id: Iffe77fdf25fb756a7f8c2e1474789dfc14235ac7
(cherry picked from commit 4b0da6460c2d1f155c1a566a88354aa93096a6de)

subject: Use setkey() when modifying mapping type columns
messages:
[{'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2017-11-21 11:03:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8655, 'date': '2017-11-21 11:34:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)

Would be good to cover the case where two commands append to map in the same transaction.'}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2017-11-21 11:36:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

(2 comments)

Will add a test'}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2017-11-21 14:26:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

So, just to state here... There's a con in using setkey() for this. What if someone is trying to clear up the mapping ? Right now they could just pass an empty dict ({}) and that would do it. But if we use setkey() it won't change anything.

What do you think about this approach Terry ? Maybe we need something more elaborated to be able to add and also delete keys from mappings ? Let me know"}, {'account_id': 5756, 'date': '2017-11-21 15:45:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I'll try to look at this carefully after I get back from PTO. Sometimes we want to completely overwrite, so I'm a little nervous about changing behavior."}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2017-11-22 10:13:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thanks Terry.

I've updated my patch in networking-ovn to not depending on this (by setting the revision number in the same command that is modifying external_ids).

What about having a separated command for modifying mapping type fileds ? That way we can use it in the transaction that is updating other parts of the resource:

class UpdateMapping(BaseCommand):
     
    def __init__(self, resource_id, table, field, add=None, del=None):
        ...

    def run_idl(self):
         res = self.api.lookup(self.table, self.resource_id)
         for key, val in self.add.items():
             res.setkey(self.field, key, val)
         for key in self.del:
             res.delkey(self.field, key)

Then we can create the more specific helper methods, for example:

def update_lsp_mapping(self, port, field, add=None, del=None):
    return UpdateMapping(port['id'], 'Logical_Switch_Port', field, add, del)

And use in the transaction as:

with transaction() as txn:
    txn.add(update_lswitch_port(...))
    txn.add(update_lsp_mapping(port, 'external_ids', add={'new_param': 'new_value'}, del=['old_param'])"}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2018-05-28 12:16:55.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-21 11:03:22.000000000', 'message': 'Use setkey() when modifying mapping type columns

When updating columns of mapping type use setkey() instead of
overwritten the whole value with a new one.

This is done because if we have 2 (or more) commands in the same
transaction updating the same mapping column the latest one to run will
overwrite the previous ones. For example:

Command 1 appends {"foo": "bar"} to external_ids

Command 2 appends{"baz": "qux"} to external_ids

Without setkey() the end result will be only external_ids={"baz": "qux"}
instead of {"foo": "bar", "baz": "qux"}.

Change-Id: I7bed8400ce0dcb5f60e658e30a4a560c3f60395b
'}]
commit_message:
Use setkey() when modifying mapping type columns

When updating columns of mapping type use setkey() instead of
overwritten the whole value with a new one.

This is done because if we have 2 (or more) commands in the same
transaction updating the same mapping column the latest one to run will
overwrite the previous ones. For example:

Command 1 appends {"foo": "bar"} to external_ids

Command 2 appends{"baz": "qux"} to external_ids

Without setkey() the end result will be only external_ids={"baz": "qux"}
instead of {"foo": "bar", "baz": "qux"}.

Change-Id: I7bed8400ce0dcb5f60e658e30a4a560c3f60395b

commit_message:
Deployed Server - portmap should match neutron API

The cidr property for a Neutron subnet should contain
the network cidr, not the network prefixlen.

This change fixes the example provided in the description
for the fake neutron port in deployed-server.

Closes-bug: #1772396
Depends-On: I0f8cad690a178e7b70044c38b2277a51ae3734eb
Change-Id: I8b00eda3a9c047ce73aad11cac9b13bca653c544

commit_message:
Remove replace-osd action

At present this action does not work.  While looking to repair the
functionality I found a number of issues with the current
implementation.

For now I suggest we remove this functionality, and at some point we may
consider replacing it with a `remove-disk` action.

Sync in relevant changes from charms.ceph

Depends-On: Id61b87927c43d807aacc93cf05ec8f88d91b7a39
Change-Id: Ic71d304ff65a05ab7249f4dd07adc45429a323e9

commit_message:
Deployed Server - portmap should match neutron API

The cidr property for a Neutron subnet should contain
the network cidr, not the network prefixlen.

The example portmap for the fake neutron port in tripleo
depleoyed-server is not correct. We should pass the
netowork cidr in the subnets so that the fake neutron
port subnets attribute return something that match
what an actual neutron port would return.

Change-Id: I0f8cad690a178e7b70044c38b2277a51ae3734eb
Related-Bug: #1772396

commit_message:
Only attempt to bootstrap the cluster if we are not already done

This should dramatically reduce hook executions during
mon-relation and leader-setting hook executions as
we only need to notify all related units on bootstrap

Change-Id: I45f4dc47f811bdc3bbe5171ca9a388f0e207f1d0
Related-Bug: #1719436

implementation.

For now I suggest we remove this functionality, and at some point we may
consider replacing it with a `remove-disk` action.

Change-Id: Id61b87927c43d807aacc93cf05ec8f88d91b7a39

tempest assert on wait_for_status failures

so tests can spot the problems earlier and more accurately.

Change-Id: Iba4307ea921e19b01c2ab1bc3dd4066a41f0bb11

commit_message:
Update add_table_names script

Add a new script, tools/add_table_names, that adds to the output of
ovs-ofctl dump-flows the table names, including those allocated by the
new datapath. It relies on the new datapath output file.

Change-Id: I82069d1d084145ea0a55fd8c7ea2573ba5a86c4f

commit_message:
Add dragonflow legacy node to new datapath

Treat all existing tables as a single legacy application, and add it as
a new application to the new framework.

A special property of this application is that all tables are entry
points and exit points

Change-Id: I1acc94d9800f5c3cb0ebbb8cd298a0b6b9fd94c5
Co-Authored-By: Lihi Wishnitzer <lihiwish@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Allow to check pep8 along with D000

This commit going to remove --ignore D000 which had raised
following issues:

"D000 Cannot analyze code. Pygments package not found."

And they also fixed in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/568729/

Change-Id: Ie23b07a2909482a4b36cfe9159f42f57747927cd

commit_message:
Optimize CI triggers for instack-undercloud upgrades

Do not run tripleo-ci-centos-7-undercloud-upgrades,
when tripleo-ci-centos-7-undercloud-oooq fails. Attempting
to do an upgrade instack UC will fail as well as the
basic deployment.

Related upstream ML thread:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/
127869.html

Change-Id: I6e4e7ccc0e1690c44a4eac10d37bd66a48286c44
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

subject: Optimize CI triggers for UC containers upgrades
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3153, 'name': 'Emilien Macchi', 'email': 'emilien@redhat.com', 'username': 'emilienm'}, {'_account_id': 6926, 'name': 'Bogdan Dobrelya', 'email': 'bdobreli@redhat.com', 'username': 'bogdando'}, {'_account_id': 8449, 'name': 'Marios Andreou', 'email': 'marios@redhat.com', 'username': 'marios'}, {'_account_id': 8871, 'name': 'Elastic Recheck', 'username': 'elasticrecheck'}, {'_account_id': 9592, 'name': 'wes hayutin', 'email': 'whayutin@redhat.com', 'username': 'weshayutin'}, {'_account_id': 9976, 'name': 'Ronelle Landy', 'email': 'rlandy@redhat.com', 'username': 'rlandy'}, {'_account_id': 12715, 'name': 'John Trowbridge', 'email': 'trown@redhat.com', 'username': 'trown'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2018-05-14 12:10:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2018-05-14 12:25:16.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from containerized_undercloud_ci to undercloud_ci_pipelines'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-05-14 14:57:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I'm not convinced this will help us, tbh. As a result, the feedback loop for the developer will be higher than before since we want for a job to finish before running another job.
I see this layout useful for actual build pipelines, where we split out our jobs in re-usable roles, but in the case of these 2 jobs it's probably faster to run them in parallel, and if something fails, well it fails and we have logs to debug why."}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2018-05-14 15:02:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

As I noted in IRC, it reduces the zuul queue for tripleo CI removing the longest (upgrade) jobs *only* when it is expected to fail 100% for sure. Please do not confuse the change with splitting orthogonal jobs in pipeline. Undercloud deploy vs upgrade are 100% correlate as we test it as N-1->N, and when the latter fails in deploy job, it fails in upgrade. I'm not sure how to get stats from elastic search infra to prove my words though."}, {'account_id': 8871, 'date': '2018-05-14 15:21:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I noticed Zuul failed, I think you hit bug(s):

- tripleo-ci-centos-7-containers-multinode: https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1686542

If you believe we've correctly identified the failure, feel free to leave a 'recheck' comment to run the tests again.
For more details on this and other bugs, please see http://status.openstack.org/elastic-recheck/"}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2018-05-14 16:09:56.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from undercloud_ci_pipelines to ci_pipelines'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2018-05-14 16:22:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Emilien, you're right and this would extend the CI pipeline run time for some extent, but I think that given some very long running jobs in parallel, like that:

tripleo-ci-centos-7-containers-multinode	FAILURE in 3h 04m 26s

and given the quite long running RDO CI OVB alongside, I think those change worth giving it a try - the overhead would be not so much in the end, given the aforementioned points..."}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2018-05-15 09:09:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2018-05-15 09:16:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3: Patch Set 2 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2018-05-28 09:56:32.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Optimize CI triggers for UC containers upgrades

Do not run tripleo-ci-centos-7-containerized-undercloud-upgrades,
when tripleo-ci-centos-7-undercloud-containers fails. Attempting
to do an upgrade into containerized UC will fail as well as the
basic deployment for containerized UC.

Related upstream ML thread:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/127869.htm

Change-Id: I858efb531d627e5df5c7ed5af461ef4e49a03b71
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Connect new Datapath object to ryu base

Add the new datapath object to the ryu base application class. With this
change, the new datapath will be initialized once Dragonflow connects to
OVS.

This change also updates the base testing code to allow the new object
to be used.

Change-Id: I12d716d334afdec889ddfbb825ce0b34215e6b23
Co-Authored-By: Lihi Wishnitzer <lihiwish@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Optimize CI triggers for some of OC deploy jobs

Do not run tripleo-ci-centos-7-3nodes-multinode,
when tripleo-ci-centos-7-containers-multinode fails.
CI stats [0] show it highly likely fails, when the latter
fails as well. Given that both a quite faily and long running,
that could benefit the other queued zuul jobs and shorten its
wait time in the end.

[0] http://tripleo.org/cistatus.html

Related upstream ML thread:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/
127869.html

Change-Id: Ia11bbc235855ce5d833f7b229aed7cf04cecd695
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-11 16:35:38.000000000', 'message': 'flake8: Add W503 to ignore list as invalid

W503 according to the [1] pycodestyle docs is not supposed to be
enabled. But it is.

W503 is something we will likely never enable as it is a personal
style decision and can change depending on the code. There is no one
right answer. Interestingly there is also a W504 which is the opposite
check.

[1] http://pycodestyle.pycqa.org/en/latest/intro.html#error-codes

Change-Id: I1025f21a57837e97280f82baba50fdd823a190cc
'}]
commit_message:
flake8: Add W503 to ignore list as invalid

W503 according to the [1] pycodestyle docs is not supposed to be
enabled. But it is.

W503 is something we will likely never enable as it is a personal
style decision and can change depending on the code. There is no one
right answer. Interestingly there is also a W504 which is the opposite
check.

[1] http://pycodestyle.pycqa.org/en/latest/intro.html#error-codes

Change-Id: I1025f21a57837e97280f82baba50fdd823a190cc

messages: [{'account_id': 19184, 'date': '2018-05-23 08:35:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 19184, 'date': '2018-05-23 10:27:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:\n\nrecheck'}, {'account_id': 1736, 'date': '2018-05-23 23:49:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 19194, 'date': '2018-05-28 06:57:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-23 08:35:32.000000000', 'message': 'rpc server executor reverted to blocking

The threading executor consumes allot of memory, as the max thread count
is 5 x cpus, and this cannot be limited.
Blocking or threading doesnt make allot of difference for our needs,
as api parallelism is blocked by the GIL.

Change-Id: I10eab99204c779d93590552c2eb4b3ed207975d7
'}]
commit_message:
rpc server executor reverted to blocking

The threading executor consumes allot of memory, as the max thread count
is 5 x cpus, and this cannot be limited.
Blocking or threading doesnt make allot of difference for our needs,
as api parallelism is blocked by the GIL.

Change-Id: I10eab99204c779d93590552c2eb4b3ed207975d7

commit_message:
bugfix - notifier changes the vertex as it notifies

This causes following notifiers to use the changed value.
So worker processes, that receive their data by these notifications,
receive a changed value. specifically alarms contain a redundant field
 'resource'

Change-Id: I84268a8ff458374f40d09854fa64f6e66034ca27

commit_message:
bugfix - datasource driver single instance

Data stored in driver members is lost, since a new instance is created
per every call.
Should be the same instance for get_all, get_changes and notifications.
Doctor driver required a change because alarm cache now works

Change-Id: I235d0be0a8218eec654702cbee6c7844f15a9ca1

messages:
[{'account_id': 28128, 'date': '2018-05-21 18:05:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2018-05-21 18:05:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 23847, 'date': '2018-05-22 21:59:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

[{'created': '2018-05-21 18:05:22.000000000', 'message': 'Add min/max values to ironic-python-agent integer config options

None of the existing ironic-python-agent integer config options
included min or max values. Added appropriate min/max values for
each of the ten integer config options.

Change-Id: I98709a45d099aea62c9973beb6817591cb445a9c
Story: 1731950
'}, {'created': '2018-05-23 17:12:26.000000000', 'message': 'Add min/max values to integer config options

None of the existing ironic-python-agent integer config options included
min or max values. Added appropriate min/max values for the integer
config options.

Two of the integer options are for ports (listen_port and
advertise_port). These were changed to use the more appropriate
oslo_config cfg.PortOpt instead of cfg.IntOpt. PortOpt has the proper
min and max values built in.

Change-Id: I98709a45d099aea62c9973beb6817591cb445a9c
Story: 1731950
'}]
commit_message:
Add min/max values to integer config options

None of the existing ironic-python-agent integer config options included
min or max values. Added appropriate min/max values for the integer
config options.

Two of the integer options are for ports (listen_port and
advertise_port). These were changed to use the more appropriate
oslo_config cfg.PortOpt instead of cfg.IntOpt. PortOpt has the proper
min and max values built in.

Change-Id: I98709a45d099aea62c9973beb6817591cb445a9c
Story: 1731950

commit_message:
Use the neutron user on the message queue

Similar to neutron-gateway we can use the same user created on the
message queue that neutron-api uses. This will avoid any potential
permissions problems.

Change-Id: I6a5c2f0f38f636db19e3c13af85a79fe5b570013

xenial-queens. We need to test against released packages.

commit_message:
Fixes missing 'geneve' network type

The network type drivers were missing 'geneve', which will allow nodes to
attach nova instances to geneve networks.  This should be allowed by
default[1].

[1]https://github.com/openstack/puppet-neutron/blob/master/manifests/plugins/ml2/type_driver.pp#L121

Change-Id: I1a1bfaa2619edde8a463cd3a6bc6412738d7f596
Closes-Bug: #1762667
(cherry picked from commit dd7fd5586c41a8a873ba18426e277b7f36551e9b)

commit_message:
Replace port 35357 with 5000 for "auth_url"

Based on the change in Keystone Install Guide [1],
this patch replace port 35357 with 5000 for "auth_url".

For more details, please check similar changes which have been done
on other projects: Nova [2], Neutron [3], Cinder [4], Glance [5].

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/541857
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/562812
[3] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/566491
[4] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/565464
[5] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/558932

Change-Id: Ifc1c8c047f607f715fcaf30c45676bda3b5a5cec

Replace port 35357 with 5000

Now that the v2.0 API has been removed, we don't have a reason to
include deployment instructions for two separate applications on
different ports.

subject: Add the parameter service-id for service cleanup command
messages:
[{'account_id': 25388, 'date': '2018-05-17 06:52:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 25376, 'date': '2018-05-17 10:19:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 25695, 'date': '2018-05-18 07:01:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 9535, 'date': '2018-05-18 07:47:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

Originally this was not added to the client because the service_id is not something you can see without going into the DB, but it is true that if the API accepts the parameter so should the client.

Since we usually refer to the UUIDs as IDs I believe it's worth mentioning in the help that in this case we actually refer to the id field in the DB."}, {'account_id': 25388, 'date': '2018-05-21 06:01:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Published edit on patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 9535, 'date': '2018-05-21 08:49:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

Thanks for adding this.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-05-27 15:44:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

Kind of think this should have a release note to point out this addition, but looking at help will show it for those that actually need to know about it, so I suppose this is fine.'}, {'account_id': 8871, 'date': '2018-05-27 17:11:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

I noticed Zuul failed, I think you hit bug(s):

- legacy-tempest-dsvm-neutron-src: https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1663529

If you believe we've correctly identified the failure, feel free to leave a 'recheck' comment to run the tests again.

commit_message:
Add the parameter service-id for service cleanup command

There isn't service_id param in cinderclient. We have this param
in cinder, so add this param in the cinderclient.

Change-Id: I579741595f91802bcf117029889567f234b5b14c
Closes-bug: #1771721

commit_message:
V3 jsonschema validation: scheduler_hints

This patch adds jsonschema validation for below scheduler_hints API
* POST /v3/{project_id}/volumes

Partial-Implements: bp json-schema-validation

Change-Id: I6c5ad70fef2baf9a9e99d1f311569a4052292e74

'cafe-ui' and checks tox default targets defined in the created
project, i.e. pep8, py27-local, py35-local, py35dj20-local,
eslint, karma-local, docs-local and releasenotes,

commit_message:
Add zuul job for checkbuild target

The new job runs 'tox -e checkbuild' to create a test project
'cafe-ui' and checks tox default targets defined in the created
project, i.e. pep8, py27-local, py35-local, py35dj20-local,
eslint, karma-local, docs-local and releasenotes,

Change-Id: I5a94939fb278a756b7118c6c2a4acdb5b98170ef
Co-Authored-By: Shu Muto <shu.mutow@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Fix tox jobs and remove tox_helper.sh

Horizon plugins needs horizon on master branch for our
master development and test.

Recent changes in CI infra and horizon force to change horizon
installation, and added tox_helper.sh as trivial fix.

Now, reasonable fix found for horizon plugins,
so this patch fixes them.

Also, use python3.5 for jobs except py27.

Change-Id: I3c4c7736b67c97a2b9b7ba8cf329528295269e6a

commit_message:
Django 2.0 support

Replace django.core.urlresolves with django.urls

(In Django 2.0) The django.core.urlresolvers module is removed
in favor of its new location, django.urls.
It was deprecated in Django 1.10:
https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/2.0/releases/1.10/#id3

Add py35dj20 job to test Django 2.0 integration.

Change-Id: If4cb1ed6e1a15dc7acb7e9f3d8e564c23c9326c1

Horizon plugins needs horizon on master branch for our
master development and test.

Recent changes in CI infra and horizon force to change horizon

commit_message:
Run tox on created plugin

This patch enables to run `tox` for testing generated plugin.
Also, adds tox targets for eslint, karma, docs and releasenotes
on generated plugin. In generated tox, "-local" targets are executed
for local tox test. In Ci infra, target jobs, i.e. without "-local"
targets, will be ran as setting,

To add these new targets, this patch refreshes requirements
and fixes tests.

Horizon plugins should be tested with Horizon on master branch,
so parent tox, i.e. "checkbuild" target on ui-cookiecutter/tox.ini,
will clone horizon from git into .tox/checkbuild/horizon/.

lower-constraints job will be added in subsequent patch.

Change-Id: I4a1fd2d90b086f6ebec80d44cc36ef8beb3dbf0b

commit_message:
Allow to create VPN service with chinese character

The VPN service's name could contains chinese character,
 which will cause generate config file failed.
The patch use replaces VPN service's name with VPN service's id
in the strongswan and openswan templates.

Change-Id: I80365014d3215d217b902f550a49af5699fae803

subject: Fix node 'op' operation return vaule miss 'action'
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 8246, 'name': 'Qiming Teng', 'email': 'tengqm@outlook.com', 'username': 'tengqm'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 22623, 'name': 'Erik Olof Gunnar Andersson', 'email': 'eandersson@blizzard.com', 'username': 'eoandersson'}, {'_account_id': 23517, 'name': 'chenyb4', 'email': 'cybing4@gmail.com', 'username': 'Yuanbin.Chen'}, {'_account_id': 25674, 'name': 'Jude Cross', 'email': 'jucross@blizzard.com', 'username': 'problem_v'}, {'_account_id': 27224, 'name': 'Duc Truong', 'email': 'duc.openstack@gmail.com', 'username': 'dtruong2'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 23517, 'date': '2018-05-18 02:50:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 23517, 'date': '2018-05-18 02:56:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 23517, 'date': '2018-05-18 02:58:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 22623, 'date': '2018-05-18 04:12:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Could we add some unit tests for this to show case and test what kind of payload we are expecting?'}, {'account_id': 23517, 'date': '2018-05-21 02:26:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 8246, 'date': '2018-05-21 03:15:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

Please try avoid returning the whole Node back to client. It will break the API spec: http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/senlin/tree/api-ref/source/nodes.inc#n592'}, {'account_id': 23517, 'date': '2018-05-21 04:01:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

@Qiming
If the senlin api 'op' operation retrun value miss 'action', senlinclient will get 'None' value. It is not print action.

RESP: [202] Location: http://10.20.10.10:8778/v1/actions/c6888a52-1bf1-4606-8108-5adbfd65934d Openstack-Api-Version: clustering 1.0 Vary: OpenStack-API-Version Content-Type: application/json Content-Length: 4 X-Openstack-Request-Id: req-2af792f9-9705-429c-b175-5d216a8ec85a Date: Mon, 21 May 2018 03:54:00 GMT Connection: keep-alive
RESP BODY: null"}, {'account_id': 23517, 'date': '2018-05-22 01:57:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

@Qiming
The node 'op' operation return value different from API response values.
https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/clustering/#perform-an-operation-on-a-node"}, {'account_id': 8246, 'date': '2018-05-22 02:46:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

If 'action' is needed and documented to be returned but it is missing from the current implementation, then fix it because it is a bug.

What confused me is that you are now returning the *whole* Node object back. This is not what the API document is saying. Get my point now?"}, {'account_id': 23517, 'date': '2018-05-22 03:13:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

@Qiming
The node return value is dictionary not object. eg: {'action': action_id}
Look node op code:
https://github.com/openstack/senlin/blob/master/senlin/engine/service.py#L2018"}, {'account_id': 23517, 'date': '2018-05-22 03:21:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Cluster 'op' operation code different node 'op' operation.
https://github.com/openstack/senlin/blob/master/senlin/api/openstack/v1/clusters.py#L308

The cluster 'op' operation return is right."}, {'account_id': 27224, 'date': '2018-05-22 05:38:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

@qiming, I think what chenyb4 is saying is that the current implementation of node operation doesn't return the action id at all, only the location field.

The current unit test for node operation mocks the return value for the rpc call to return the action id dictionary:
https://github.com/openstack/senlin/blob/master/senlin/tests/unit/api/openstack/v1/test_nodes.py#L1010

However since the current implementation of node operation pops 'action' from the rpc return value, engine_response will be empty after this call:
https://github.com/openstack/senlin/blob/master/senlin/tests/unit/api/openstack/v1/test_nodes.py#L1012

The unit test then only verifies that result has location field when it compares engine_response and response because the location field is added to engine_response:
https://github.com/openstack/senlin/blob/master/senlin/tests/unit/api/openstack/v1/test_nodes.py#L1016"}, {'account_id': 22623, 'date': '2018-05-23 04:41:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

It looks to me like we should just change location to action?

Alternatively we could do something like this

action_id = node.pop('action')
result = {
    'location': '/actions/%s' % action_id,
    'action': action_id
}
return result

I don't like the idea of returning an object, as it gives very little insight to what is actually returned. I rather be explicit here to make the code easier to understand."}, {'account_id': 23517, 'date': '2018-05-23 05:14:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Ok, I will change.'}, {'account_id': 23517, 'date': '2018-05-23 05:28:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 27224, 'date': '2018-05-23 17:24:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 25674, 'date': '2018-05-23 18:53:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

I agree with Duc on this one. 

Unit tests could use a little work.'}, {'account_id': 23517, 'date': '2018-05-24 01:39:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 27224, 'date': '2018-05-24 04:54:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 23517, 'date': '2018-05-24 05:10:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 22623, 'date': '2018-05-24 15:48:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+1

LGTM'}, {'account_id': 27224, 'date': '2018-05-24 16:12:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 23517, 'date': '2018-05-25 01:12:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 22623, 'date': '2018-05-25 01:27:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 27224, 'date': '2018-05-25 01:32:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 8246, 'date': '2018-05-27 23:54:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 23517, 'date': '2018-05-28 01:10:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Fix node 'op' operation return vaule miss 'action'

This patch fix 'op' return value, When 'action' not in return
value, senlinclient will get 'None', The right value need
'action' in return value. Example:
"{u'action': u'f98a6b0e-7b4a-4f57-9cc4-881839dd0992'}",

Change-Id: I3d75a68a2e5491cc34e51a01c626ee00522490cb
Closes-Bug: #1771916

commit_message:
Change masakari service-type from 'ha' to 'instance-ha'

According to the discussion [1] on ML and the patch [2], masakari
service-type should be replaced with 'instance-ha' from
'ha'.

This patch fixes this service-type at masakari-monitors side.

NOTE:
- This patch should be merged only after the new release of
  python-masakariclient which includes the new service-type.
- Removed below unused constants defined in test_masakari.py:
    - PROFILE_TYPE
    - PROFILE_NAME

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-January/126314.html
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/534875/

Change-Id: I7fa18c8cd656777447e098719318044b7a0efd08

commit_message:
Fix rabbitmqctl cluster_name regexp extractor

rabbitmqctl outputs can be multilined if some
strings are too long, thus breaking the grep regexp.
This can happen if container's hostname is too long.

This patch inlines the rabbitmqctl output before
matching the regexp

Change-Id: I2a1adb2b6c60cae1c5b6b289cc938c26c0ef12bd
Closes-Bug: #1773394
Signed-off-by: parasitid <parasitid@yahoo.fr>
(cherry picked from commit 0af23b4704dc4a7926b39a23f9d991a40d91ca3e)

commit_message:
Update openvswitch version

Previously, we installed openvswitch 2.7.1 from git. This is problematic
in new kernels due to symbol name collision[1]. A fix was commited and
tagged as 2.9.1.

[1] https://github.com/openvswitch/ovs/commit/138df3e563de9da0e5a4155b3534a69621495742

Change-Id: Id24b6caaeabfa22b10308b9bfbc48b8c1c7a6b9a

Publisher service to update Publisher table

When there are no events for a long time, the publisher
service does not update the publisher table. This may
make it look like the publisher is inactive. This will
cause some pub/sub messages to be lost.

This change makes the publisher automatically update
the timestamp in the database every once in a while
(half the timeout time).

Change-Id: Ie02120f2e31552e8bd93fc02101294500c959ac2

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-25 17:18:24.000000000', 'message': 'allow passing ansible variables to ansible tests

Provide possibility to pass ansible variables through environment (i.e.
ANSIBLE_VAR_FLAVOR for setting `flavor` variable in ansible playbooks)
to the ansible functional tests. This can be used i.e. for running tests
in other than devstack cloud, where images, flavors, networks are not
matching devstack.

This is an initial change in a series of changes to enable executing
ansible tests in other clouds as a validation.

Change-Id: I40bc16241345ec4f39481f46dc0ad3a3075201fe
'}]
commit_message:
allow passing ansible variables to ansible tests

Provide possibility to pass ansible variables through environment (i.e.
ANSIBLE_VAR_FLAVOR for setting `flavor` variable in ansible playbooks)
to the ansible functional tests. This can be used i.e. for running tests
in other than devstack cloud, where images, flavors, networks are not
matching devstack.

This is an initial change in a series of changes to enable executing
ansible tests in other clouds as a validation.

Change-Id: I40bc16241345ec4f39481f46dc0ad3a3075201fe

commit_message:
Update openvswitch version

Previously, we installed openvswitch 2.7.1 from git. This is problematic
in new kernels due to symbol name collision[1]. A fix was commited and
tagged as 2.9.1.

[1] https://github.com/openvswitch/ovs/commit/138df3e563de9da0e5a4155b3534a69621495742

Change-Id: Id24b6caaeabfa22b10308b9bfbc48b8c1c7a6b9a

commit_message:
Additional fix for hostname validation regex

With the addition of the hostname validation check for Rocky release,
the regex used does not allow for '+' to be used in a hostname. This
breaks the Dell EMC VMAX driver as + symbols are used in constructing
host/pool names. To resolve this issue, add '+' to the regex string.

Change-Id: Ib58741bcf5b1abe7196e9b2ad37d849776b17fbe
Closes-Bug: #1772659

commit_message:
Remove useless args in create_group_from_src

Remove status, project_id
and user_id args from create_group_from_src.

Those args will cause error when using cinderclient since
schema validation in Cinder side.

Change-Id: Iba9a45625f9e6423e8e582425605ca184238cde9
Closes-Bug: #1772375

commit_message:
Fix the argument for cinder-manage command.

Correct argument is online_data_migrations, not online-data-migrations.

Change-Id: I3bfc9893e004cef4842b7bd432ac5f90cff1349b

commit_message:
V3 jsonschema validation: os-services

This patch adds jsonschema validation for below os-services API's
* PUT /v3/{project_id}/os-services/disable
* PUT /v3/{project_id}/os-services/disable-log-reason
* PUT /v3/{project_id}/os-services/enable
* PUT /v3/{project_id}/os-services/get-log
* PUT /v3/{project_id}/os-services/set-log
* PUT /v3/{project_id}/os-services/freeze
* PUT /v3/{project_id}/os-services/thaw
* PUT /v3/{project_id}/os-services/failover_host

Change-Id: I37365eb4d667263bb192f52d06135b2fd7298fef
Partial-Implements: bp json-schema-validation

Currently if it happens we allow the exception to fall through, which
results in node's last_error populated. Since it's not supposed to be

commit_message:
Gracefully handle NodeLocked exceptions during heartbeat

Currently if it happens we allow the exception to fall through, which
results in node's last_error populated. Since it's not supposed to be
a dangerous condition, only log a warning instead.

Change-Id: I3419824a94d305101b987ffa0bb901be158f916c
Story: #2002094
Task: #19785

commit_message:
Improve validation of 'nets' parameter

Enforce either 'network' or 'port' is provided. The request will
be rejected if both or none of them is specified.

Change-Id: I8b1b4ebb45c9a7bf6e0301a2ee54d654ff5a483b

This should be more convenient since the module is closer to
its consumers.

  by the underlying interval_timeout function).
* Fix incorrect :returns: docstring.
* Allow the caller to override which attribute to use.
  (ironic nodes have provision_state and power_state, not status).
* Add some logging when looping (the underlying interval_timeout

  with how it is treated inside the loop.

commit_message:
Several improvements to resource.wait_for_status

* Clarify that interval and wait can be None (already supported
  by the underlying interval_timeout function).
* Fix incorrect :returns: docstring.
* Allow the caller to override which attribute to use.
  (ironic nodes have provision_state and power_state, not status).
* Add some logging when looping (the underlying interval_timeout
  call does it, but just "Waiting %d seconds" is not enough in
  the context of a big caller application).
* Use lower() on the initial check for status to be consistent
  with how it is treated inside the loop (correctly handling None,
  which is a possible state according to the CI).

Change-Id: Icd58fdab1438b738d3ce6cd3162bb7445e9a2bf9

commit_message:
Deal with revision_number in neutron update_port tests

The revision_number increments each time a port is touched. The test
didn't take that in to account, but was passing because there was a bug
in neutron where update wasn't returning the results containing the
results of db trigger code, like updated_at and revision_number.

Change-Id: I489b3077ce0577f13d156ba14a8fd51461ba061e

commit_message:
Replace assertRaisesRegexp with assertRaisesRegex

This replaces the deprecated (in python 3.2) unittest.TestCase
method assertRaisesRegexp() with assertRaisesRegex()

Change-Id: I74e6341e502f8296254298f8fa0c4901af404cf2

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-02-28 19:19:06.000000000', 'message': 'Be a little more explicit about checking ok status

Response objects behave like bools, so the original code here works.
However, when reading the line, it looks like a check to see if resp
exists as opposed to being None, which is a condition that can never
happen in this code flow. Be nice to subsequent users who may not know
that Response has an overriden __bool__ method and get confused. (not
saying that happend to me causing me to go verify in the requests source
code at all. Just musing about a theoretical future developer. I
promise)

Change-Id: I0451aede5aa291b7488529c0cc9f71b8ef1ddd5e
'}]
commit_message:
Be a little more explicit about checking ok status

Response objects behave like bools, so the original code here works.
However, when reading the line, it looks like a check to see if resp
exists as opposed to being None, which is a condition that can never
happen in this code flow. Be nice to subsequent users who may not know
that Response has an overriden __bool__ method and get confused. (not
saying that happend to me causing me to go verify in the requests source
code at all. Just musing about a theoretical future developer. I
promise)

Change-Id: I0451aede5aa291b7488529c0cc9f71b8ef1ddd5e

commit_message:
Allow to check pep8 along with D000

This commit going to remove --ignore D000 which had raised
following issues:

"D000 Cannot analyze code. Pygments package not found."

And they also fixed in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/568729/
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/570236/

Change-Id: I3f35c65d385dc65ccefbac608498ad85ff4a4d71

commit_message:
Fix H103 Apache license header check

It's good to have a license header check. Amusingly - this actually
caught a real error in one of the headers. I'll leave it as an exercise
for the reader as to which one was a real error.

Change-Id: I46bee047d798fcb384e711462bc7463ca8745ee8

commit_message:
Add comment about W503 being skipped

It's on purpose and we do not want to 'fix' occurances. If anything, a
rule checking the opposite of W503 would be preferrable.

Change-Id: I246b23e7e1ead1682167f3bf076ce563697217e6

subject: Fix F405 errors
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-09 14:22:32.000000000', 'message': 'Fix F405 errors

F405 is a bit more aggressive about not being able to tell if a
symbol is valid due to * imports. Just go ahead and fix it since *
imports are, in fact, hard to deal with.

As a result of fixing this, there are two actual bugs that were hidden
that the check found, so the fix seems worthwhile.

Change-Id: If76b0943e16e0c7264b75829838c4a715342ab9d

commit_message:
Fix F405 errors

F405 is a bit more aggressive about not being able to tell if a
symbol is valid due to * imports. Just go ahead and fix it since *
imports are, in fact, hard to deal with.

As a result of fixing this, there are two actual bugs that were hidden
that the check found, so the fix seems worthwhile.

Change-Id: If76b0943e16e0c7264b75829838c4a715342ab9d

Add get_volume_limits() support

Add the ability for a user (nodepool) to get the volume limits of a
cloud.

Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

messages:
[{'account_id': 28338, 'date': '2018-05-25 15:42:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2018-05-25 15:42:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 23163, 'date': '2018-05-25 16:02:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Hello,

Thank you for your patch. Could you please extend the commit message to explain what was the problem and how you fix it? I know that some analysis is written on the bug report, but when we review patches in the command line, accessing the bug report is now always easy. Moreover, it's a good practice to make the git patches/commits self-explanatory."}, {'account_id': 28338, 'date': '2018-05-25 17:08:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 23163, 'date': '2018-05-25 17:37:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

strings are too long, thus breaking the grep regexp.
This can happen if container's hostname is too long.

commit_message:
Fix rabbitmqctl cluster_name regexp extractor

rabbitmqctl outputs can be multilined if some
strings are too long, thus breaking the grep regexp.
This can happen if container's hostname is too long.

This patch inlines the rabbitmqctl output before
matching the regexp

Change-Id: I2a1adb2b6c60cae1c5b6b289cc938c26c0ef12bd
Closes-Bug: #1773394
Signed-off-by: parasitid <parasitid@yahoo.fr>

commit_message:
Trivial: Update pypi url to new url

Pypi url changed from [1] to [2]

[1] https://pypi.python.org/pypi/<package>
[2] https://pypi.org/project/<package>

Change-Id: I651f4480aaddcedf8e88879429d4a386ddb33206

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-14 18:49:13.000000000', 'message': "Fix duplicate entries in /etc/sysconfig/iptables

Commit 94ca328e5d309a5617043b2944e65df79271e0cd
introduced filters for ephemeral firewall rules
managed by Ironic Inspectors iptables PXE filter.
These new filters cause duplicate entries in the
persisted firewall rules.

sed expression '/-m comment --comment/p' was used
to ensure the ironic-inspector api port is not
accidentally removed. But the expression also
matches several other entries causing duplicates
to be written.

This change enhances the expression to check for
'-m comment --comment' and 'ironic-inspector'.

Closes-Bug: #1771128
Change-Id: I0a75a7aff9b1a0afbad63e4b6b5159f4351c7ee8

commit_message:
Fix duplicate entries in /etc/sysconfig/iptables

Commit 94ca328e5d309a5617043b2944e65df79271e0cd
introduced filters for ephemeral firewall rules
managed by Ironic Inspectors iptables PXE filter.
These new filters cause duplicate entries in the
persisted firewall rules.

sed expression '/-m comment --comment/p' was used
to ensure the ironic-inspector api port is not
accidentally removed. But the expression also
matches several other entries causing duplicates
to be written.

This change enhances the expression to check for
'-m comment --comment' and 'ironic-inspector'.

Closes-Bug: #1771128
Change-Id: I0a75a7aff9b1a0afbad63e4b6b5159f4351c7ee8

commit_message:
Configure cors for glance for additional usability

In order to enable image uploads in horizon we need to configure several
things in glance, namely cors. This change implements default overrides
allowing the system to provide for direct image uploads through horizon
which will greatly improve our usability, especially for new users.

Change-Id: I19f4027dd30b0ba22cbb195c676802ce908d3e8f
Closes-Bug: #1747684
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit 01d3912af4b22cb22eabbf4d9d97df4b709fdb80)

[{'created': '2018-05-17 06:18:18.000000000', 'message': 'Add mount options for better machinectl performance

The machinectl default options, while functional, could be tuned for
better overall performance. This change adds several options which will
ensure container workloads are using the lest amount of storage with the
best possible performance.

For more information on the options being used see
 * https://btrfs.wiki.kernel.org/index.php/Manpage/btrfs(5)#MOUNT_OPTIONS

All of the "machines" mount procedures have been moved into a unified
volume task file. This was done to ensure a consistent experience across
our supported distros. To ensure any new options are non-disruptive, the
mount handler has been changed to use "reload-or-restart" which will first
try to reload a mount instead of restarting it mounts.

Conflicts:
1. tasks/lxc_cache_preparation.yml
   due to include vs include_task
2. tasks/lxc_cache_preparation_systemd_old.yml
   due to https://review.openstack.org/554003 not
   being ported back to queens

commit_message:
Add mount options for better machinectl performance

The machinectl default options, while functional, could be tuned for
better overall performance. This change adds several options which will
ensure container workloads are using the lest amount of storage with the
best possible performance.

For more information on the options being used see
 * https://btrfs.wiki.kernel.org/index.php/Manpage/btrfs(5)#MOUNT_OPTIONS

All of the "machines" mount procedures have been moved into a unified
volume task file. This was done to ensure a consistent experience across
our supported distros. To ensure any new options are non-disruptive, the
mount handler has been changed to use "reload-or-restart" which will first
try to reload a mount instead of restarting it mounts.

Conflicts:
1. tasks/lxc_cache_preparation.yml
   due to include vs include_task
2. tasks/lxc_cache_preparation_systemd_old.yml
   due to the following not included in queens
   a. https://review.openstack.org/554003
   b. https://review.openstack.org/544977

Change-Id: Ia962fd4c5bb2a73ddd884d3bb3837c47b43d6903
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit bf9a79d05e1b903fa94522821af69b022f79d96c)

commit_message:
Add task to regather facts after run

This role will introduce quite a bit of state change within the host
it's deployed on. After the run we should force regather facts to ensure
we have the most up-to-date information before running any other
playbooks/roles on the host.

Change-Id: I5b2724d8aada3a1a083bdebbc1d24869ad1c9a8c
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
